story:
Hi, there!

Do you ever believe in something so much that you can't ignore it?  That belief can range from learning a musical instrument, your dedication to the gym or dance, or to a social cause. 

Well, I have a belief in participating in creating positive change within issues greater than myself. Among the many issues I'm passionate about, I'm tremendously moved by issues that affect children. During my undergrad at the University of Toronto, I actively participated in several organizations and programs that either predominantly or had a focus on empowering youth, protecting children and international development. As a result of my involvement with several world issues, I studied Political Science and Latin American Studies at the University of Toronto. (Please scroll down to my past work experiences.)

After much hard work and dedication, I've been accepted to the United Nations Professional Placement Programme whereby a selected group of young Canadian professionals are chosen nation wide to participate in the United Nations system as Junior Professional Consultants. The aim is to pair Canadians to an international UN office that promotes human rights, the rule of law and sustainable development. I am overwhelmed with joy to say that I have been selected to work for UNICEF Peru as Communications for Development Assistant.

UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund) aims to provide long-term humanitarian and development aid to children and women in developing countries. UNICEF has five focus areas: 

1)Child survival and development

2)Basic Education and gender equality

3) HIV and AIDs reduction in children and mothers

4) Child protection

5)Policy advocacy and partnerships

My work responsibilities in UNICEF Peru as C4D Assistant would be:

1) Assist in the review and adjustment of the programme communication strategy and in the implementation, effective management, facilitation and execution for social and behavioural change in support of efficient and effective programme delivery.

2) Contribute to the design, pre-testing and timely production of culturally relevant programme communication materials, meeting requirements and quality standards.

3) Contribute to the development and enhancement of strong partnerships with community groups, leaders and other partners in the community and civil society for promotion of participation in social and behavioral changes programme goals.

4) Support the development of effective training materials and the implementation of activities to build capacity in participatory and behaviour communication at various government levels.

5) Assist in the provision of effective technical support to government counterparts in the development and effective use of communication for social development.

6) Assist in the monitoring and evaluation of Communication for Development programme activities and preparation of reports, documentation of experiences, lessons learned, best practices and new methods .

Objective of interning for UNICEF Peru: 

The objective of this work experience is twofold. Firstly, it is to further expand my knowledge on the intricacies impeding and supporting childhood development; intricacies include the role of civil society, and government bodies to tackle systemic issues impeding childhood development, the role of educational institutions in supporting and enhancing the academic success of children and adolescents, social and cultural factors in child development, and many more. My second objective, is to hone in on my personal skills and consolidate the information I will have adquired through this internship,  with my future career in contributing to the resolution of several issues impeding child development.  

Unfortunately due to the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFAIT), the Canadian government has cut more than $130 million dollars towards international aid and development initiatives. This internship was previously paid, however, due to this merger, it is unpaid. 

As I have a tremendous amount of student debt, please help me raise the funds to maintain my cost of living in Lima, Peru as I intern for UNICEF for six months.  

Financial Breakdown:  **Though I am aiming to raise $3500, I indeed need more.**

Local transportation: $350

Food: $2000

Flight (to&fro): $1000

Program Fee: $2500

Emergency funds: $200


My past experiences include: 

UofT Students for International Development (Website: click Here) 

With a team of more than 10 students, I travelled to Chiquián, Peru to work within the education sector in elementary schools. I interviewed teachers, parents, and children regarding what issues impede the academic success of students, and moving forward with programs with the teachers to alleviate this issue. 

UofT's Organization of Latin American Students (Website: click Here ) 

For many years, I worked with an executive team that aimed to promote the Latin American culture on campus with a focus on building relationships with the Latin American community.  During my presidency, I led our executive team to work on our Volunteer Fair, Charity Open Mic and several other initiatives to bring more awareness of social issues pertinent to the Latin American community in Toronto and abroad while bringing university students together.  

TakingITGlobal (Website: click here )

TIG is an organization that focuses on global issues by promoting awareness and engagement of global youth whose main platform is in the virtual world. Youth from around the world are encouraged and incentivised to take positive action in their communities. I worked as Multilingual Special Projects coordinator which created a module to enhance the amount of translations done in spanish and french.

Latin American Studies Program,  University of Toronto (Website: click here )

With a great team of professors and students within the academic program, we worked in facilitating students through their undergraduate degree in LAS and supporting their personal research. In addition, we worked on planning, organizing, and executing academic conferences, workshops and lectures regarding topics in Latin America.

Centre for Social Innovation (Website: click here )

With an incredible staff, we worked together in supporting the community of social innovators and organizations within the co-working space. My role was to increase social cohesion in the space through community animation, which was an enriching experience. With several members in the space we successfully ran social events such as a community gardening group, hot chocolate fundraiser, and Docs N' Talks (documentary showings followed by discussion).  The CSI staff and I worked hard to cultivate a friendly and supportive environment for our members and vistors so they can work together and through their talents and work ethic to create systems change to ameliorate our world. 

Through these experiences, I have gained a lot of knowledge and skills I aim to cultivate further on the topic of children's rights and development in underdeveloped countries.

story:
With your support we can continue our journal!

Dear Friends and Colleagues,

As you know, I have been the editor of this journal for a number of years. We are all doing our utmost to support Sephardic culture and heritage by promoting new ideas and discussions as well as Sephardic creativity.

I hope to continue our work at this journal by raising a modest sum to continue the upkeep necessary for this endeavor. We have over 1,000 people who regularly read Sephardic Horizons. We'd like to keep up with the costs and with our commitment to our membership. To do so, we'd like to provide a stipend for someone to assist with the work of the journal, as well as pay for our continuing overhead including the web work.

Please donate here to this campaign and spread it to those who you think may be interested!

Thank you so much for all your efforts in making Sephardic Horizons a continued success!

Judith Roumani

Editor

http://sephardichorizons.org/About.html

More on Sephardic Horizons:

Much interesting new research and writing is being conducted in the broader field of Sephardic studies as well as its core, and professional scholars are joined by enthusiastic lay scholars interested in preserving and disseminating the knowledge of their own communities. Sephardic Horizons wishes to throw a spotlight on valuable new writing wherever it is being produced.

We are especially committed to publishing new writing and interesting features in Ladino/Judeo-Spanish. Although this journal concentrates on the ‘core’ Sephardic culture, that of the Jews who were exiled from the Iberian Peninsula, it includes not only the core culture but also that of Jews who consider themselves Sephardim in the wider sense. In this definition, the Jewish communities of the former Ottoman Empire and the broader Mediterranean and Middle East, even those who do not trace their origin to Iberia, have commonalities deriving from the centuries when Babylon was the preeminent Jewish center which, as it faded, passed the baton to the Mediterranean communities, above all to al-Andalus. Since the expulsion from Spain in 1492, many Sephardim returned to these same regions, as well as emigrating to Europe and the Americas.

Sephardic Horizons has grown out of the Vijitas de Alhad of Washington, an informal group that meets in the Washington DC area to celebrate Sephardic culture, Sephardic music and the Ladino or Judeo-Spanish language. The group was founded by Flory Jagoda and developed by Ralph Tarica, Albert Garih, Rosine Nussenblatt, Bension Varon, Leon Taranto, and others beginning around the year 2000.

story:
Hi! I am Anna. 

I'm a Nashville native looking outside the box to change the world and making better future for the generations to come. By nature, I'm a healer. I teach yoga. I am a holistic health counselor and Reiki Master. Teaching people to love and understand their own unique and amazing body.

You can help! 

My goal is to become certified in aromatherapy!

Aromatherapy is an amazing tool that will highly benefit my other practices as a healer. 

Benefits of aromatherapy are endless, from stress relief to sinus relief to anti-bacterial properties to enhanced energy and stamina... the list goes on. 

Help me learn and grow myself and my practice. People are sick, unhappy and off balance. I want to use these tools of education to impact people in a way sustains balance and well-being for a whole life time and pave a path for the future.   

Break'n it down.

I need $1500. This pays for tuition... books... supplies like oils and bottles to mix aromas. 

By funding my campaign, not only with you be benefitting the lives of others but you can look forward to your own person healthy living gift box! 

Reach my goal or not... whatever you give goes completely to getting me in school. 

Impact of love. 

I am truly passionate about change in the world by helping people live happy, balanced and of quality. You can help me do that in creating this cycle of love and giving. 

Please, visit my web-site www.AnnaWillhite.com to learn more about my work or find me on facebook www.facebook.com/wildirisholistic.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute? You can still help. 

  • Let's get the word out! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it!

story:
Give a geeky theater student a leg up!

Hey guys!

My name is Amanda. I'm 21 years old and a native of Brooklyn, NY, aka, the land of super expensive living. I'm a college student, attending St. Joseph's Brooklyn Campus for Speech Communications and Theatre. You might know me from around the interwebs, I've RPed Black Canary on Tumblr for a Young Justice RP, and I'm known as @UndiesofWondy on Twitter and  Tumblr. Like most college students, guess what? I'm broke. Like, really, really, really broke. 

However, I'm totally prepared to make a fool out of myself on the internet in order to fund something super awesome mega foxy hot!

I'm trying to raise money to attend CONvergence, a convention out in MN. I've toyed with the idea of possibly moving out there, although it'd be awesome just to see someplace new. I have a chance to be on some fan panels that I signed up for, and to be honest, I'd really just love to meet some super cool people who are into the same things that I am. 
 
Here's where you guys come in! I've already saved some money, found crash space, all that good stuff. But attending CONvergence, at the cheapest, will cost me around 350 for airfare and hotel. (Indiegogo's minimum fundraising level is $500, but I only need $350!)
 
Literally, every little bit will help me out. And if I do go to CONvergence, I will legitimately cosplay comic book artist Christopher Jones. Seriously. Can you honestly say you don't want to see that? And maybe even cosplay something else that I'll let everyone vote on. 

Lastly, thank you in advance for sharing this page, checking it out, or donating! I love you all, no matter what. And here's my derpy face. I hope it does not overload your screens with epic win. 

- Amanda

The Headshot of an Actress featuring Amanda

More Normaler Amanda

Performing Amanda

Teapot Amanda

Black Canary Amanda

Supergirl Amanda

Zatanna Amanda (or is that Annataz Zdnama?)

Mario Amanda

God of Thunder Amanda

Thanks for taking a look! :-)

story:
This project has closed, but we have relaunched Part 2 here:  http://igg.me/p/283531?a=1269137

Sending Children to School

Your campaign donation will directly contribute to the school fees and related costs of sending the children of OrphanAid Africa (OA) to school.

In Ghana, illiteracy and lack of career training are two main challenges that make the escape from poverty so difficult. This is especially true for Ghanaians living in rural communities, and even more so for women and children. Education and training are the two essential foundations for building a future with greater opportunities, and for this reason it is an area in which we focus our strongest efforts.

Despite free basic education in Ghana, the costs related to sending a child to school (books, uniforms & shoes, transportation, PTA dues, etc.) oftentimes make it impossible for families to send their children to school. While understanding the importance of schooling, some parents feel forced to place their children in an orphanage since they believe this may be the only chance they have to receive a quality education.

OrphanAid Africa supports these families by providing for school fees and related costs, or supplementing these costs based on a family’s financial circumstances. Specially assigned OrphanAid Africa staff members closely monitor the progress of the children to ensure that they are regularly attending classes, have access to the resources they need and are doing their best to be successful.

In July of 2006, OA constructed and equipped a new primary school in the poor village of Ayenyah, a community that had never before had a local school. This school provides basic education to children that are supported through the OA foster family program, as well as the children of Ayenyah and its surrounding communities. Since its opening, there has been a significant improvement in the education level of the school's students, especially in the subject areas of English, mathematics, reading and writing. The school is also one of the first in the country to have integrated classrooms for children with mental disabilities. Currently, this school serves more than 561 students and adults.

In line with the mission to provide vulnerable children with opportunities to grow up in a positive environment, OrphanAid Africa has started an extensive sports program which serves children from vulnerable families. Through this program, children have opportunities to participate in sports and recreation, thereby encouraging greater self-esteem, better health and positive relationships with other children as well as adult mentors and role models.  

Your donation, large or small, truly makes a difference at OrphanAid Africa! For questions, or to learn more about OrphanAid Africa's mission and commitment to education, please visit www.oafrica.org or contact usa@oafrica.org.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Facebook this link

* Tweet this link!

Another great way to be a part of OrphanAid Africa’s campaign is to help us get the word out on Twitter and Facebook! Thank you for your support!

For more information about OrphanAid Africa please visit www.oafrica.org.

story:
Short Summary

Since 1972, the Red Balloon Day Care Center has been a strong philanthropic institute in the Harlem/Washington Heights community.  For almost two decades we have been able to distribute $85,000/year in scholarships to working families and full-time parent students.  About one-third of our working families receive assistance.  In 2012, our city government funding (ACS) was  completely eliminated as a consequence of nationwide budget cuts.  Moreover, our two largest fundraising events, previously hosted at rent-free venues were terminated due to changes in those venues’ policies. 

 What makes these cuts particularly devastating is that they came very late in the enrollment/admissions process after we had already committed to giving scholarships. We decided to honor the scholarships offered to those families. For many of our families the loss of their scholarship would mean losing their jobs and other sources of income to stay home with their children.  This has left us with a deficit of $60,000. We are seeking a short- term infusion of money to make up for this loss and get back to a balanced budget in the next year.  We are even facing the possibility of having to close down our school if we do not get this much needed help.  We are optimistic that this eventuality can be avoided with your outside contributions.

We are exploring every avenue possible.  We are already beginning to formulate new marketing ideas and financial strategies for the future to allow us to continue assisting needy families and supporting the fabric of our neighborhood and local community. 

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised during this campaign will help us subsidize $60,000 towards the cost of our scholarship benefits for the 15 students currently receiving financial aid. 

We are a 501c3 so all donations are tax deductible.  Visit our site at www.redballoonlearningcenter.org and learn more about us.

Donors who give $100 or more get a 2013 Red Balloon calendar filled with wonderful pictures created by our amazingly talented children!!!

 

 The Impact

While there are many “childcare” facilities in New York City, very few have the unique personal and physical resources that Red Balloon has and which your contribution could help preserve.  Some of these include:

    • Commitment to Food Justice: The Red Balloon is aware of issues of food inequality in urban areas and the lack of food quality that permeates some neighborhoods we serve.  Because of that the Red Balloon provides the children with a nutritious breakfast, a fresh homemade lunch, and healthy snacks.  Furthermore the children learn early on to tend to their community garden and understand the value of urban sustainability.

    • Valuing Social Diversity: While New York City is noted for its social diversity, when it comes to educational settings this global metropolis experiences significant levels of segregation, particularly across class and racial lines.  By drawing families and caregivers from a range of socio-economic backgrounds we reaffirm our commitment to respecting and valuing diversity in terms of class, race, sexual orientation, nationality, language, and household composition.  This commitment to diversity is sustained in part by our scholarship program.

    • Preparation For Kindergarten Entrance:  Over the last twenty years we have helped more than 300 children to gain entrance to the top public and private schools in NYC and to Gifted &Talented programs and, eventually, to top colleges and universities.  For many of these children, this would not have happened without the Red Balloon. 

    • Superb Space and Facilities:  The Red Balloon is housed in an expansive  facility with bright spacious classrooms, a large indoor gym, an outdoor playdeck, a built-in wading pool, a large lending library, and an outdoor planter garden.  Growing up in an urban area places  constraints on children's ability to have safe play areas to develop their motor skills.  We take optimal advantage of our great facility by daily engaging the children in developmentally appropriate physical challenges, instilling in them the value of physical activity and healthy living habits.

 

Why do we merit the financial support we are requesting?

The heart and soul of the Red Balloon is our commitment to financially helping low income families by providing them a high quality educational head start as we strive to be a model of exemplary early childhood practices.  We partner with our families to create a safe and nurturing environment where children are guided to reach their full potential, while planting the seeds for a love of learning and a lifetime of social commitment.  These goals serve as an impetus for our fundraising endeavors.

Most importantly, we believe that the current economic situation has tipped the balance toward the haves and abandoned the have-nots.  For 40 years our school has fought to maintain a parity of families from all backgrounds but the resources that we depended upon have all but disappeared.  We need the help of your private donations to stem the tide. 

 

 Testimonials

"We think of the Red Balloon often and with great fondness.  You told us you would keep our kids safe and help them learn.  You did that and so much more.  You helped pave the road for our children's love of learning, their ability to form relationships outside our family, and helped build their self confidence.  We are grateful for our time at the Red Balloon."  -Katherine K. alumni parent.  Both children currently attend Bank Street with a substantial scholarship.

 "The Red Balloon is a diamond in the rough.  It's a place where parents know their children will be loved, educated, nutritously  fed, and well cared for in a safe, nurturing, and diverse environment.  It represents a community of parents, teachers, and administrators who collectively work for the good of the children.  That's why parents return when they have a new addition to their family.  We have had two sons there and plan on sending our new daughter in two more years.  We love it here and love what the school represents." -Diana & Vaughn H.

story:
UPDATE: I can't reflect on the total here, but I've received everything I need to pay for the housing and fellowship tuition costs from the BBQ plate/bake sale fundraiser and donations given to me in person and on this site. Thank you so much for all the support! :) Anything I receive today forward will help pay for any extra costs such as meals and gas money.

My Story

Poynter Institute has selected me to participate in the Poynter Summer Fellowship for College Students. This prestige program only selects 30 students from the country to study in St. Petersburg, Florida during May 15 through 27.

More information on this fellowship can be found here.


The Impact

With this fellowship, I will learn the skills I need to produce strong multimedia stories, work side-by-side with some of the best journalism coaches, and know what to expect when I walk into a professional newsroom. I will represent Austin Community College and Austin with the fellow 29 students who are participating with me.


What We Need & What You Get

To participate in this fellowship, I need funds to afford the tuition, housing, and travel costs. I did apply for financial assistance and will be fundraising to earn additional funds, but I'll need as much help as I can.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate funds, you can assist me with fundraising. Spread the word. Donate your time with any schedule fundraisers. Any and all help is appreciated.


By the way, the photo of me is by Dana Manickavasagam. :)

story:
My name is Brent Shultz and I am writing to request scholarship funding to attend the California State University Summer Arts 2014 Program. The course I am interested in attending this summer is Drama 621, Stage Combat: Unarmed and Small Weapons SPT Intensive; a two week intensive course focusing on the skills and techniques needed to create the illusion of violence on stage through the use of weapons and fight choreography. Coordinated by Dr. Terry Smith, this course will culminate in a Skills Proficiency Test by a Society of American Fight Directors Fight Master.

  Currently, I am in my final year at The New School for Drama in New York City, working towards a Master of Fine Arts Degree in Acting. As part of the second year curriculum the students study Stage Combat under Broadway Fight Director, Tom Schall; with whom I also worked as Fight Captain for our production of Shakespeare's MacBeth last Spring. While the class covers a wide range of stage combat techniques and skills needed by actors working in most basic theatrical productions, it does not grant any  accreditation towards our development as working professional artists. 

  Last year I was able to participate in CSU Summer Arts Rapier and Dagger workshop and received my certification through SAFD. Actors who have professionally certified fight training are more marketable and find work in theater and film both as performers and as fight choreographers. Since gaining my first accreditation I have worked as fight captain for my director's thesis in the fall, as well as staging fights for the 2nd year directors' classic adaptations at my school. Also, I have had the privilege to be Tom Schall's assistant for the stage combat course taught at The New School this year: the first time a student has had the opportunity in our program. It is my intent to use the training gained from Dram a 621 to raise myself to the next tier of my stage combat training, Actor/Combatant, as well as to further my professional acting career. 

 While this is an amazing opportunity allotted to perspective students it isn't without its costs. I am a full-time graduate candidate living temporarily in NYC and since I am only able to work part-time, money is of great concern. This years tuition for out-of-state graduate students is set at $3,093.00 towards 3 credits.

I have received a generous scholarship, but I am fund-raising on my own to defray housing and travel expenses. I consider myself to be a hard worker and any  success I have achieved has stemmed from a great deal of preparation meeting the right opportunity. Any and all assistance I might receive to rise to this occasion would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your time and consideration.


Sincerely,


Brent E Shultz

story:
The campaign is over, we thank you for all the support!

You can still donate; check our Facebook page for more information on that which will come soon!

If you are interested in getting a jersey, please fill out this form!


The Team of Weird, Quidditch-Playing Belgians!

Yup, we are the national Belgian quidditch team, unofficially dubbed the Gryffins, composed of Belgian quidkids dying to get over to Vancouver, B.C., Canada to play in the Global Games hosted by the International Quidditch Association!

What is the Global Games? Well, go check out the official page by the IQA! In brief, it is a tournament of all the national teams that can front quidditch teams held every two years.

This year will be Belgium’s debut at the second Global Games where the first was held as the “Summer Games” in Oxford, UK before the Olympics. In fact, this is the first year Belgian has supported a quidditch team in any capacity, so we are trying to really prove to the world what we are made of in the land of frites and chocolate. The team will primarily be made up of players from the two official teams of the past season: the Qwaffles and the Dodos, teams that are third and sixth in Europe, respectively… nothing to scoff at!


(Unfortunately there was not footage of the Qwaffles nor the Dodos at the championships)

The money raised here will be used to help reduce the cost of the players’ plane tickets across not only the Atlantic but the great country of Canada if not pay in full! Luckily, their coach calls Vancouver home, so accommodation is not too much of an issue, but the plane tickets are currently looking like quite a barrier to cross, unfortunately, especially as many of us are broke, young students or workers.

Our Goal and Why So Much?

Unfortunately, 8000km is no easy trek, and airlines know this! Tickets and expected costs (team transport and team meal options) are looking to be about €1,000 with round-trip tickets from Brussels to YVR. Our goal of €8,500 would get a team of 10 players over to Vancity with minor amounts of additional costs. That would allow the team of 10 to get over to Van with enough time in advance to shake off the effects of jetlag and understand the city before actually competing all the while socializing and interacting with early arrivers and then get the 9 remaining Belgians (David, the coach, is staying to finish his studies at UBC) back home safe, sound and hopefully champions!

Teams consist of minimum 7 and maximum 21 players. Our base goal is to get a team of 10 over there, offering basic field play and some substitutes, but it is not optimal. We, however, are aiming, through additional funding schemes as well, to get more than 10 players there, but this would ensure Belgium is well represented at IQA’s biggest, most international event ever.

The funding time ends on 15 May to ensure adequate time to purchase tickets as well as give our supporters enough time to donate! If you wish to donate more after this date, Belgium Muggle Quidditch, the parent organization of all Belgian quidditch teams, always welcomes donations!

Perks!

As you can see, we have a super wide variety of perks! Because we have fans and supporters on at least two different continents in dozens of countries, we had to separate some perks by an individual’s location, as posting things from Belgium might get expensive. Moreover, certain perks might be hand-delivered, some might be posted from Canada from the coach’s house or from Belgium itself. Because our perks are subject to, well, borders, there are some constraints we will be dealing with, namely beer and maple syrup, that is why there are limited numbers. Otherwise, we are excited to offer our supports some top-notch deals, be it some of the most amazing beer, some motherflippin’, pure maple syrup (tested and proven to be perfect; a staple of the coach’s flat in Brussels) or even adopting quidkids!

Really, what this means for us...

We have not played quidditch for too long here in our bizarre, little country, it is true. This tournament is not only a way to show the world that we mean business, but it is a way to pump up Belgium, really kickstart teams in not only our country, but the Benelux and surrounding countries!

The quidditch community is a fantastic group of people from all walks of life. Your contribution helps to promote not just Team Belgium, but gender equality, general sportsmanship and international cooperation!

Other Ways You Can Help

Already funded us? Way too completely broke to fun us? Hop on over to Facebook and Twitter to like and follow us!

Belgium Muggle Quidditch on Facebook

@belgiumquid

Brussels Qwaffles

Deurne Dodos


Thank you! Merci! Dank u! Danke schön!



– FR –

La campagne est terminée. Nous vous remercions pour votre soutien !

Il est toujours possible de faire un don; checkez notre page Facebook pour en savoir plus.

Si les maillots vous intéressent et que vous avez envie d'en acheter un ou plusieurs, remplissez cette formulaire !


C'est quoi cette folle équipe des joueurs de quidditch belges?

Hey, nous sommes l’équipe nationale de Belgique du quidditch, officieusement surnommée les Griffons, composée de quidkids déterminés à se rendre à Vancouver, B.C., au Canada, pour participer aux Jeux Mondiaux organisés par l’Association Internationale de Quidditch!

Que sont les Jeux Mondiaux? En bref, c’est un tournoi organisé tous les deux ans, réunissant les équipes nationales de tous les pays où le quidditch se joue!

Cette année, la Belgique sera présente pour la première fois aux Jeux Mondiaux, dont la première édition s’est tenue à Oxford, au Royaume-Uni, sous le nom de “Summer Games“. En fait, c’est carrément la première année du quidditch en Belgique, et nous avons vraiment envie de prouver au monde de quoi nous sommes capables dans le pays des frites et du chocolat! L’équipe sera constituée principalement de joueurs des deux équipes officielles de la saison : les Qwaffles et les Dodos, respectivement 3ème et 6ème dans le classement européen!

L’argent récolté ici sera utilisé pour réduire (si pas couvrir entièrement) les frais de déplacement des joueurs, pas seulement d’un côté à l’autre de l’océan Atlantique, mais aussi du Canada! Heureusement, notre coach peut nous héberger sans problème puisqu’il va justement s’installer à Vancouver, mais les billets d’avion sont vraiment un obstacle pour nous, particulièrement parce que nous sommes constitués d’une majorité d’étudiants fauchés ou de jeunes travailleurs.

Notre but, et pourquoi autant?

Malheureusement, un voyage de 8000km n’est pas donné! Les billets d’avion et les frais prévus (transport et repas de l’équipe sur place) avoisinent les 1000€ par personne. Notre but de 8500€ permettrait d’envoyer une équipe de 10 joueurs à Vancouver avec un minimum de frais additionnels, suffisamment tôt avant la compétition pour que tout le monde puisse se remettre du long voyage et faire connaissance avec les autres joueurs tout en découvrant la ville, et bien sûr les ramener chez eux sains et saufs et, espérons-le, champions!

Les équipes sont constituées de minimum 7 joueurs et maximum 21. Notre but minimum est d’avoir 10 joueurs, ce qui nous laisserait 3 remplaçants, mais ce n’est pas optimal. Nous espérons donc pouvoir former une équipe plus grande, grâce notamment aux fonds que nous récolterons par d’autres moyens, pour représenter la Belgique en nombre à l’événement le plus grand et le plus international organisé par l’IQA!

La récolte d’argent prendra fin le 15 mai pour nous permettre d’acheter nos billets d’avion à temps ainsi que pour laisser assez de temps à nos donateurs ! Si vous souhaitez continuer à nous aider financièrement après cette date, sachez que Belgium Muggle Quidditch, l’organisation parente de toutes les équipes de Quidditch belges, accueille volontiers les dons!

Récompenses!

Pour les récompenses (perks) en français, cliquez ici.

Comme vous pouvez le voir, nous proposons une grande variété de récompenses! Comme nous avons des fans et supporters dans au moins deux continents et des douzaines de pays, nous avons dû séparer les récompenses par région, les frais de port depuis la Belgique n’étant pas négligeables. Cependant, certaines récompenses pourront être livrées en mains propres, d’autres envoyées depuis le Canada, ou la Belgique. Dans ces deux derniers cas, nous serons limités par les douanes, notamment en ce qui concerne la bière ou le sirop d’érable, ce qui explique pourquoi leurs quantités sont limitées. A part ça, nous sommes impatients de pouvoir vous présenter des occasions uniques en leur genre en vous envoyant certaines de nos meilleures bières ou du sirop d’érable pur venant tout droit du Canada (testé et définitivement parfait, selon plusieurs membres de l’équipe), ou même en adoptant un joueur!

Ce que ça représente pour nous…

Il est vrai que le Quidditch est très récent dans notre petit pays bizarre. Ce tournoi n’est donc pas seulement notre chance de prouver au monde notre volonté et notre sérieux, mais aussi de donner envie à de nombreuses autres équipes belges, du Benelux et des pays alentours, de se développer en leur montrant jusqu’où elles pourraient arriver!

Aide supplémentaire

Vous avez déjà contribué à notre projet? Ou vous n’avez pas les moyens de nous aider financièrement? Vous pouvez nous soutenir gratuitement, en nous suivant sur Facebook et Twitter!

La communauté quidditch se compose d'un fantastique melting pot de personnes. Votre contribution nous aiderait non seulement à promouvoir l'équipe belge, mais également l'égalité entre les genres, l'esprit sportif et la coopération internationale!

Belgium Muggle Quidditch sur Facebook

@belgiumquid

Brussels Qwaffles

Deurne Dodos


Thank you! Merci! Dank u! Danke schön!


– NL –

De campagne is voorbij, we danken jullie voor de steun!

Je kan nog altijd doneren: bekijk onze Facebookpagina voor meer informatie die binnekort zal binnenkomen!

Als je geïnteresseerd bent in het kopen van sen truitje, vul dit bestelformulier in!

Wat is deze gekke team van Belgische Zwerkbalspelers?

Jazeker! We zijn de nationale Belgische zwerkbal ploeg, onofficieel genaamd “the Gryffins”, samengesteld uit Belgische ‘quidkids’ die een moord zouden plegen om naar Vancouver, B.C., Canada te geraken om daar te kunnen spelen op de ‘Global Games’ georganiseerd door de ‘International Quidditch Association’!

Wat is ‘Global Games’? Wel… bekijk deze link! Kort samengevat is het een toernooi waar alle nationale ploegen, dat quidditch ploegen hebben, tegen elkaar spelen. Dit wordt georganiseerd om de 2 jaar.

Dit jaar zou het België’s debuutjaar zijn op de 2de Global Games, dat eerder gehouden werd in Oxford, Verenigd Koninkrijk onder de naam “Summer Games” juist voor de Olympische Spelen. In feite is dit het eerste jaar dat België de kans krijgt om een team te sturen, dus willen we ons echt bewijzen en de wereld laten zien waartoe we in staat zijn! Het nationaal team zal bestaan uit spelers van de 2 officiële teams van het afgelopen seizoen: de ‘Qwaffles’ en de ‘Dodos’. Deze teams horen bij de top van Europa, met hun respectievelijke 3de en 6 plaats in Europa, wat niet niets is.

Al het geld dat hier verzameld wordt zal ons helpen om zoveel mogelijk van onze kosten voor de vliegtickets naar beneden te halen of zelfs sommige tickets volledig te betalen. Gelukkig is de coach van het nationale team wonende in Vancouver waardoor accommodatie ter plekke geen probleem is. De vliegtickets blijven zeer duur, wat voor veel van onze spelers niet te betalen valt, voornamelijk omdat vele van ons amper geld hebben, studenten of werknemers zijn.

Ons doel en waarom zo veel?

Spijtig genoeg is 8000 km geen makkelijke weg om te overbruggen én luchtmaatschappijen weten dit ook! Tickets en voorziene kosten (zoals vervoer en maaltijden) lijken rond de €1000 te liggen per speler. Ons doel van €8500 zou een team van 10 spelers naar Vancouver kunnen krijgen. Dit zou het team genoeg tijd geven voor het evenement begint om door de jetlag te geraken, voordat ze aan de competitie moeten starten.

Ploegen bestaan uit minstens 7 en maximum 21 spelers. Dit doel is gesteld om een ploeg van 10 personen, om te “deftig” te kunnen spelen met enkele wisselspelers, maar het is zeker niet optimaal. We proberen, door andere projecten, meer spelers naar Vancouver te krijgen maar de weg is lang. Dit alles zou wel België een plaats garanderen op het grootste, meest internationale evenement van de IQA.

Deze campagne loopt tot 15 mei 2014, zodat we genoeg tijd hebben om effectief onze vliegtickets te kopen, maar ook genoeg tijd geven aan onze supporters om te doneren! Als u wenst te doneren na de campagne, aanvaard ‘Belgium Muggle Quidditch’ donaties hier!

Extraatjes!

Voor de extraatjes (perks) op nederlands, klick op.

Zoals u kan zien, hebben we een gevarieerd aanbod van extras die u kan verkrijgen! Omdat we fans en supporters hebben op 2 verschillende continenten en meerdere landen, moeten we sommige extraatjes splitsen per continent, omdat het verzenden van zaken vanuit België nogal duur kan zijn. Sommige extraatjes kunnen bij u geleverd worden, sommige kunnen verstuurd worden vanuit Canada, en andere dan weer vanuit België zelf. Omdat onze extraatjes bepaald worden door (letterlijk) grenzen, zijn er beperkingen zijn, met name bier en ahoornsiroop. Al bij al, zijn we verheugd dat we deze zaken aan u kunnen voorbrengen zoals bier, ahoornsiroop of zelf het ‘adopteren’ van een quidkid!

Wat betekent dit voor ons?

We zijn nog niet zo lang bezig met quidditch hier, in het kleine België, maar dit grote toernooi is de kans van ons leven om de wereld te laten zien dat we het menen. Dat we België op de kaart kunnen zetten en een mooie toekomst geven aan de komende ploegen in België, maar zeker ook in de Benelux.

Help

Ons al geholpen? Of bent u helemaal platzak zelf? Ga naar onze Facebook en Twitter om ons te liken en volgen!

Belgium Muggle Quidditch op Facebook

@belgiumquid

Brussels Qwaffles

Deurne Dodos


Thank you! Merci! Dank u! Danke schön!
story_txt:
The campaign is over, we thank you for all the support!
You can still donate; check our Facebook page for more information on that which will come soon!
If you are interested in getting a jersey, please fill out this form!




The Team of Weird, Quidditch-Playing Belgians!Yup, we are the national Belgian quidditch team, unofficially dubbed the Gryffins, composed of Belgian quidkids dying to get over to Vancouver, B.C., Canada to play in the Global Games hosted by the International Quidditch Association!What is the Global Games? Well, go check out the official page by the IQA! In brief, it is a tournament of all the national teams that can front quidditch teams held every two years.This year will be Belgium’s debut at the second Global Games where the first was held as the “Summer Games” in Oxford, UK before the Olympics. In fact, this is the first year Belgian has supported a quidditch team in any capacity, so we are trying to really prove to the world what we are made of in the land of frites and chocolate. The team will primarily be made up of players from the two official teams of the past season: the Qwaffles and the Dodos, teams that are third and sixth in Europe, respectively… nothing to scoff at!(Unfortunately there was not footage of the Qwaffles nor the Dodos at the championships)The money raised here will be used to help reduce the cost of the players’ plane tickets across not only the Atlantic but the great country of Canada if not pay in full! Luckily, their coach calls Vancouver home, so accommodation is not too much of an issue, but the plane tickets are currently looking like quite a barrier to cross, unfortunately, especially as many of us are broke, young students or workers.Our Goal and Why So Much?Unfortunately, 8000km is no easy trek, and airlines know this! Tickets and expected costs (team transport and team meal options) are looking to be about €1,000 with round-trip tickets from Brussels to YVR. Our goal of €8,500 would get a team of 10 players over to Vancity with minor amounts of additional costs. That would allow the team of 10 to get over to Van with enough time in advance to shake off the effects of jetlag and understand the city before actually competing all the while socializing and interacting with early arrivers and then get the 9 remaining Belgians (David, the coach, is staying to finish his studies at UBC) back home safe, sound and hopefully champions!Teams consist of minimum 7 and maximum 21 players. Our base goal is to get a team of 10 over there, offering basic field play and some substitutes, but it is not optimal. We, however, are aiming, through additional funding schemes as well, to get more than 10 players there, but this would ensure Belgium is well represented at IQA’s biggest, most international event ever.The funding time ends on 15 May to ensure adequate time to purchase tickets as well as give our supporters enough time to donate! If you wish to donate more after this date, Belgium Muggle Quidditch, the parent organization of all Belgian quidditch teams, always welcomes donations!Perks!As you can see, we have a super wide variety of perks! Because we have fans and supporters on at least two different continents in dozens of countries, we had to separate some perks by an individual’s location, as posting things from Belgium might get expensive. Moreover, certain perks might be hand-delivered, some might be posted from Canada from the coach’s house or from Belgium itself. Because our perks are subject to, well, borders, there are some constraints we will be dealing with, namely beer and maple syrup, that is why there are limited numbers. Otherwise, we are excited to offer our supports some top-notch deals, be it some of the most amazing beer, some motherflippin’, pure maple syrup (tested and proven to be perfect; a staple of the coach’s flat in Brussels) or even adopting quidkids!Really, what this means for us...We have not played quidditch for too long here in our bizarre, little country, it is true. This tournament is not only a way to show the world that we mean business, but it is a way to pump up Belgium, really kickstart teams in not only our country, but the Benelux and surrounding countries!The quidditch community is a fantastic group of people from all walks of life. Your contribution helps to promote not just Team Belgium, but gender equality, general sportsmanship and international cooperation!Other Ways You Can HelpAlready funded us? Way too completely broke to fun us? Hop on over to Facebook and Twitter to like and follow us!Belgium Muggle Quidditch on Facebook@belgiumquidBrussels QwafflesDeurne DodosThank you! Merci! Dank u! Danke schön!– FR –La campagne est terminée. Nous vous remercions pour votre soutien !Il est toujours possible de faire un don; checkez notre page Facebook pour en savoir plus.Si les maillots vous intéressent et que vous avez envie d'en acheter un ou plusieurs, remplissez cette formulaire !
C'est quoi cette folle équipe des joueurs de quidditch belges?
Hey, nous sommes l’équipe nationale de Belgique du quidditch, officieusement surnommée les Griffons, composée de quidkids déterminés à se rendre à Vancouver, B.C., au Canada, pour participer aux Jeux Mondiaux organisés par l’Association Internationale de Quidditch!Que sont les Jeux Mondiaux? En bref, c’est un tournoi organisé tous les deux ans, réunissant les équipes nationales de tous les pays où le quidditch se joue!Cette année, la Belgique sera présente pour la première fois aux Jeux Mondiaux, dont la première édition s’est tenue à Oxford, au Royaume-Uni, sous le nom de “Summer Games“. En fait, c’est carrément la première année du quidditch en Belgique, et nous avons vraiment envie de prouver au monde de quoi nous sommes capables dans le pays des frites et du chocolat! L’équipe sera constituée principalement de joueurs des deux équipes officielles de la saison : les Qwaffles et les Dodos, respectivement 3ème et 6ème dans le classement européen!L’argent récolté ici sera utilisé pour réduire (si pas couvrir entièrement) les frais de déplacement des joueurs, pas seulement d’un côté à l’autre de l’océan Atlantique, mais aussi du Canada! Heureusement, notre coach peut nous héberger sans problème puisqu’il va justement s’installer à Vancouver, mais les billets d’avion sont vraiment un obstacle pour nous, particulièrement parce que nous sommes constitués d’une majorité d’étudiants fauchés ou de jeunes travailleurs.Notre but, et pourquoi autant?Malheureusement, un voyage de 8000km n’est pas donné! Les billets d’avion et les frais prévus (transport et repas de l’équipe sur place) avoisinent les 1000€ par personne. Notre but de 8500€ permettrait d’envoyer une équipe de 10 joueurs à Vancouver avec un minimum de frais additionnels, suffisamment tôt avant la compétition pour que tout le monde puisse se remettre du long voyage et faire connaissance avec les autres joueurs tout en découvrant la ville, et bien sûr les ramener chez eux sains et saufs et, espérons-le, champions!Les équipes sont constituées de minimum 7 joueurs et maximum 21. Notre but minimum est d’avoir 10 joueurs, ce qui nous laisserait 3 remplaçants, mais ce n’est pas optimal. Nous espérons donc pouvoir former une équipe plus grande, grâce notamment aux fonds que nous récolterons par d’autres moyens, pour représenter la Belgique en nombre à l’événement le plus grand et le plus international organisé par l’IQA!La récolte d’argent prendra fin le 15 mai pour nous permettre d’acheter nos billets d’avion à temps ainsi que pour laisser assez de temps à nos donateurs ! Si vous souhaitez continuer à nous aider financièrement après cette date, sachez que Belgium Muggle Quidditch, l’organisation parente de toutes les équipes de Quidditch belges, accueille volontiers les dons!
Récompenses!
Pour les récompenses (perks) en français, cliquez ici.Comme vous pouvez le voir, nous proposons une grande variété de récompenses! Comme nous avons des fans et supporters dans au moins deux continents et des douzaines de pays, nous avons dû séparer les récompenses par région, les frais de port depuis la Belgique n’étant pas négligeables. Cependant, certaines récompenses pourront être livrées en mains propres, d’autres envoyées depuis le Canada, ou la Belgique. Dans ces deux derniers cas, nous serons limités par les douanes, notamment en ce qui concerne la bière ou le sirop d’érable, ce qui explique pourquoi leurs quantités sont limitées. A part ça, nous sommes impatients de pouvoir vous présenter des occasions uniques en leur genre en vous envoyant certaines de nos meilleures bières ou du sirop d’érable pur venant tout droit du Canada (testé et définitivement parfait, selon plusieurs membres de l’équipe), ou même en adoptant un joueur!Ce que ça représente pour nous…Il est vrai que le Quidditch est très récent dans notre petit pays bizarre. Ce tournoi n’est donc pas seulement notre chance de prouver au monde notre volonté et notre sérieux, mais aussi de donner envie à de nombreuses autres équipes belges, du Benelux et des pays alentours, de se développer en leur montrant jusqu’où elles pourraient arriver!Aide supplémentaireVous avez déjà contribué à notre projet? Ou vous n’avez pas les moyens de nous aider financièrement? Vous pouvez nous soutenir gratuitement, en nous suivant sur Facebook et Twitter!La communauté quidditch se compose d'un fantastique melting pot de personnes. Votre contribution nous aiderait non seulement à promouvoir l'équipe belge, mais également l'égalité entre les genres, l'esprit sportif et la coopération internationale!Belgium Muggle Quidditch sur Facebook@belgiumquidBrussels QwafflesDeurne DodosThank you! Merci! Dank u! Danke schön!– NL –De campagne is voorbij, we danken jullie voor de steun!Je kan nog altijd doneren: bekijk onze Facebookpagina voor meer informatie die binnekort zal binnenkomen!Als je geïnteresseerd bent in het kopen van sen truitje, vul dit bestelformulier in!Wat is deze gekke team van Belgische Zwerkbalspelers?Jazeker! We zijn de nationale Belgische zwerkbal ploeg, onofficieel genaamd “the Gryffins”, samengesteld uit Belgische ‘quidkids’ die een moord zouden plegen om naar Vancouver, B.C., Canada te geraken om daar te kunnen spelen op de ‘Global Games’ georganiseerd door de ‘International Quidditch Association’!Wat is ‘Global Games’? Wel… bekijk deze link! Kort samengevat is het een toernooi waar alle nationale ploegen, dat quidditch ploegen hebben, tegen elkaar spelen. Dit wordt georganiseerd om de 2 jaar.Dit jaar zou het België’s debuutjaar zijn op de 2de Global Games, dat eerder gehouden werd in Oxford, Verenigd Koninkrijk onder de naam “Summer Games” juist voor de Olympische Spelen. In feite is dit het eerste jaar dat België de kans krijgt om een team te sturen, dus willen we ons echt bewijzen en de wereld laten zien waartoe we in staat zijn! Het nationaal team zal bestaan uit spelers van de 2 officiële teams van het afgelopen seizoen: de ‘Qwaffles’ en de ‘Dodos’. Deze teams horen bij de top van Europa, met hun respectievelijke 3de en 6 plaats in Europa, wat niet niets is. Al het geld dat hier verzameld wordt zal ons helpen om zoveel mogelijk van onze kosten voor de vliegtickets naar beneden te halen of zelfs sommige tickets volledig te betalen. Gelukkig is de coach van het nationale team wonende in Vancouver waardoor accommodatie ter plekke geen probleem is. De vliegtickets blijven zeer duur, wat voor veel van onze spelers niet te betalen valt, voornamelijk omdat vele van ons amper geld hebben, studenten of werknemers zijn.Ons doel en waarom zo veel?Spijtig genoeg is 8000 km geen makkelijke weg om te overbruggen én luchtmaatschappijen weten dit ook! Tickets en voorziene kosten (zoals vervoer en maaltijden) lijken rond de €1000 te liggen per speler. Ons doel van €8500 zou een team van 10 spelers naar Vancouver kunnen krijgen. Dit zou het team genoeg tijd geven voor het evenement begint om door de jetlag te geraken, voordat ze aan de competitie moeten starten.Ploegen bestaan uit minstens 7 en maximum 21 spelers. Dit doel is gesteld om een ploeg van 10 personen, om te “deftig” te kunnen spelen met enkele wisselspelers, maar het is zeker niet optimaal. We proberen, door andere projecten, meer spelers naar Vancouver te krijgen maar de weg is lang. Dit alles zou wel België een plaats garanderen op het grootste, meest internationale evenement van de IQA.Deze campagne loopt tot 15 mei 2014, zodat we genoeg tijd hebben om effectief onze vliegtickets te kopen, maar ook genoeg tijd geven aan onze supporters om te doneren! Als u wenst te doneren na de campagne, aanvaard ‘Belgium Muggle Quidditch’ donaties hier!Extraatjes!Voor de extraatjes (perks) op nederlands, klick op.Zoals u kan zien, hebben we een gevarieerd aanbod van extras die u kan verkrijgen! Omdat we fans en supporters hebben op 2 verschillende continenten en meerdere landen, moeten we sommige extraatjes splitsen per continent, omdat het verzenden van zaken vanuit België nogal duur kan zijn. Sommige extraatjes kunnen bij u geleverd worden, sommige kunnen verstuurd worden vanuit Canada, en andere dan weer vanuit België zelf. Omdat onze extraatjes bepaald worden door (letterlijk) grenzen, zijn er beperkingen zijn, met name bier en ahoornsiroop. Al bij al, zijn we verheugd dat we deze zaken aan u kunnen voorbrengen zoals bier, ahoornsiroop of zelf het ‘adopteren’ van een quidkid!Wat betekent dit voor ons?We zijn nog niet zo lang bezig met quidditch hier, in het kleine België, maar dit grote toernooi is de kans van ons leven om de wereld te laten zien dat we het menen. Dat we België op de kaart kunnen zetten en een mooie toekomst geven aan de komende ploegen in België, maar zeker ook in de Benelux.HelpOns al geholpen? Of bent u helemaal platzak zelf? Ga naar onze Facebook en Twitter om ons te liken en volgen!Belgium Muggle Quidditch op Facebook@belgiumquidBrussels QwafflesDeurne DodosThank you! Merci! Dank u! Danke schön!

story:
About Me:

As a sixteen year old I was was granted the huge honor of getting to represent the United States as a Student Ambassador. I have always been an exceptional student. There is a planned trip for Europe this summer, but unfortunately I am not financially stable to pay for all of the tuition. This trip is a part of the program People to People funded by Dwight D. Eisenhower. His goal was to create peace through understanding. I was invited to travel this summer and tear down those cultural barriers and help bring people together. I am certain this could really be a life changing experience!

What We Need & What You Get

The tuition for this trip is $7,272. I plan on raising some of the money on my own as well, doing work and other fundraising ideas. All of the money raised here will go straight towards my tuition payment. If I get the privilege of traveling this summer I will gladly mail post cards and souvenirs from Europe in exchange for your generous donations!

The Impact

All of the money donated will go towards my tuition. I feel this could really be a life changing experience for me. I hope to grow a lot as a person from this trip. The main goal for this trip is to create peace through understanding. Therefore you could be helping break down those cultural barriers and helping bring people of diverse backgrounds together. With this trip I will be given a social studies school credit. Meaning this trip is all educational. I have always dreamed of traveling the world and studying abroad. I feel this would be a great experience, not only would I be living my long desired dream but it would also open a lot of doors filled with opportunities for me as well. With this trip I would also be given high school credit. I really look forward to getting to travel this summer!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Get the word out and tell everyone you know!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello Friends, Family, and maybe even people I don't know,

My name is Sarah and I'm trying to raise some money so that I can have the chance to study abroad this summer in Russia! Despite the Russian/Ukrainian political madness going on, the U.S. has not issued a "do not travel to" order or anything, so as of now, the study abroad program is still going. If I go I would be staying in St. Petersburg. You can see the exact program outline and all the cool excursions and program details here:

http://www.aifsabroad.com/russia/stpetersburg/summer/index.asp

I would be traveling through the AIFS program and the flight is included in the total program cost. Meals, a transportation allowance, housing, and tuition are included in the overall program fee. I would be studying the Russian language at St. Petersburg State Polytechnic University in an intensive 5 week class. I would also be taking a few elective courses about Russia.

I set my funding goal at $5,000 because that would cover the majority of my program fee. Of course if I do not get that amount, any money donated would still go toward the program fee. The same is true if for some reason I get over the amount I'm asking for.

So, what do you get for helping me? I have 4 lovely gift levels to choose from!
Also as a super crazy bonus offer, if the $150 level sells out (25 people donate at that level) I will throw in a secret gift. So make it happen if you want to know what the mystery gift is!

I'm asking for your help in going to Russia, because I've been studying the Russian language now for two semesters, and I feel that it would both help me learn the language better, and be an honor to travel to a country so close to my Slavic heritage. I chose the summer semester to study abroad so I could still finish my Bachelors in Psychology at Youngstown State on time.

Please help me visit Russia!


If you can't contribute, please consider sharing my campaign with your friends.

  • Post my campaign on your Facebook, or Twitter.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About the story...


The book tells the tale of Rya, a young girl whose life is a tapestry of emotion and experience we can all relate to. 

It is a story of love, hate, despair, hope, tragedy and motivation. 

Rya like most other young girls, dreams of success and happiness. Whimsical. Life is what happened next. Family, friends, feuds and longing surround the quest for the meaning of existence.

In a setting of terrorism, religious, racial and ethnic differences, the author dares to paint a picture that challenges the preconceptions feeding our biases. 

The freedom to think is the ultimate freedom and yet so many people are shackled by the influences of the environment they find themselves in. 

Ryas life is a resounding voice that echoes thoughts we all have at some time or the other. 

Follow the dramatic plot to an ending that will take your breath away and more importantly prompt your soul to ask the question 'what if..."? 

About me...

My name is Farsana Roya and publish under the pseudonym Shekir Pavo. 

I was born in a war torn Afghanistan and fled with family from Kabul to Germany at the age of four. 

I grew up in Germany and trained as a bilingual secretary in English and French at the Language and Interpreter academy in Munich. 

I am fascinated by human nature and how we relate to each other.  I believe that we all can contribute to making our world a better place.

I have been fortunate to have visited many countries, experienced different cultures and met amazing people.

I have worked as a volunteer, caring for the under privileged in Sri Lanka and developed a passion to make a difference in the lives of orphaned children.

My life experiences flow into my novel.

The Project...

The book I have published in Germany has been relatively successful and tells a story that we all can identify with. I want to get it translated into English to reach a wider audience and hopefully spread the message of dreams and positivity in a setting of reality.

I also am researching my next book which will be set in South Africa. 

You backing this project will make it possible for me to get the book translated into english, self publish it as well as market and distribute it worldwide. I hope that together we can create a synergy that inspires people around the world.

I hope to build other projects on the success of this venture and someday hope that our network can provide educational opportunities to children in underprivileged communities.

What I Need & What You Get

My initial aim is to raise 30 000 dollars which will be used to translate, self publish, market and distribute the book as well as setting up a web based community that focuses on the plight of underprivileged children especially regarding the development of emotional intelligence while providing opportunities for growth.

I dare to dream that this project is going to be successful beyond my wildest dreams and my longer term plans involve  launching the second book and hopefully getting both onto the silver screen!

So what is in it for you? (Besides my eternal gratitude!)

Depending on the amounts contributed,I will personally send out emails and/or letters of gratitude. I will also be sending out signed prints.

I have 300 copies of the book (In German!) which were never distributed because I changed a few things after they were printed! Its the pre 1st edition edition! :) I will personally address and send you a signed copy if you contribute in the corresponding category.

Contributors will be acknowledged as founding contributors on the social development website and can also have their pictures uploaded onto the website as part of scrolling banners etc...

I have fortunately met somebody who can provide me with personalised T Shirts, and Caps which I will personally sign and send.

For the people who make REALLY big contributions :), I promise to send all of the above as well to include their names on a special page in the translated book.

If the book ever gets made into a movie special mention will be made of these people. They will also get cameo roles if it is possible.

I believe that this project is going to be amazing but in the sad event that the goals are not met, I will still stay in touch with the people who contributed, keep the money safe and keep using other avenues to raise additional funds to realise the dream..... 

    The Impact

    Imagine a world where people are given the opportunity to reach their full potential. 

    Imagine a world where people are not judged on their gender, race, ethnicity or beliefs but rather on the attitude they have to other people and the environment.   

    Imagine a world where people stand shoulder to shoulder and respect each others differences.                                                                                                                                 

    Imagine a world of love and peace.

    Ghandi said "Be the change you want to see." 

    I believe that we can all inspire the people around us and these little drops of positivity can add add up and become a wave of change that takes us closer to a better world. 

    This book is just a part of what I see as our contribution to inspiring dreams and positive thought...

      Risks & Challenges

      Like any venture, there are inherent risks involved and I will try my best to minimise these.
      I have identified suitably qualified translators in South Africa so we can interact on a personal basis while I research my next book.
      I have partnered with a group of Medical Doctors in South Africa who are committed to social development and who will be assisting me with some of the marketing aspects surrounding the book.
      I plan to distribute the book as an ebook as well as a hardcopy and when the demand becomes sufficient, I am open to partnering with other parties to facilitate delivery.
      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you are reading this then you can help!!! I understand that not everybody is able to contribute financially but please tell your friends, family, colleagues (and everybody else!) about this project. 

      Please feel free to add my links to your websites and post on social media. Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools! 

      You can get in contact with me if you want to contribute in any other way, or think I may be able to assist you with any project you are involved in.

It is a story of love, hate, despair, hope, tragedy and motivation. 
Rya like most other young girls, dreams of success and happiness. Whimsical. Life is what happened next. Family, friends, feuds and longing surround the quest for the meaning of existence.
In a setting of terrorism, religious, racial and ethnic differences, the author dares to paint a picture that challenges the preconceptions feeding our biases. 
The freedom to think is the ultimate freedom and yet so many people are shackled by the influences of the environment they find themselves in. 
Ryas life is a resounding voice that echoes thoughts we all have at some time or the other. 
Follow the dramatic plot to an ending that will take your breath away and more importantly prompt your soul to ask the question 'what if..."? 
About me...
My name is Farsana Roya and publish under the pseudonym Shekir Pavo. 

I was born in a war torn Afghanistan and fled with family from Kabul to Germany at the age of four. 
I grew up in Germany and trained as a bilingual secretary in English and French
at the Language and Interpreter academy in Munich. 
I am fascinated by human nature and how we relate to each other.  I believe that we all can contribute to making our world a better place.
I have been fortunate to have visited many countries, experienced different cultures and met amazing people.
I have worked as a volunteer, caring for the under privileged in Sri Lanka and developed a passion to make a difference in the lives of orphaned children.
My life experiences flow into my novel.


The Project...

The book I have published in Germany has been relatively successful and tells a story that we all can identify with. I want to get it translated into English to reach a wider audience and hopefully spread the message of dreams and positivity in a setting of reality.
I also am researching my next book which will be set in South Africa. 
You backing this project will make it possible for me to get the book translated into english, self publish it as well as market and distribute it worldwide. I hope that together we can create a synergy that inspires people around the world.
 I hope to build other projects on the success of this venture and someday hope that our network can provide educational opportunities to children in underprivileged communities.   What I Need & What You Get My initial aim is to raise 30 000 dollars which will be used to translate, self publish, market and distribute the book as well as setting up a web based community that focuses on the plight of underprivileged children especially regarding the development of emotional intelligence while providing opportunities for growth.
I dare to dream that this project is going to be successful beyond my wildest dreams and my longer term plans involve  launching the second book and hopefully getting both onto the silver screen!
So what is in it for you? (Besides my eternal gratitude!)
Depending on the amounts contributed,I will personally send out emails and/or letters of gratitude. I will also be sending out signed prints.
I have 300 copies of the book (In German!) which were never distributed because I changed a few things after they were printed! Its the pre 1st edition edition! :) I will personally address and send you a signed copy if you contribute in the corresponding category.
Contributors will be acknowledged as founding contributors on the social development website and can also have their pictures uploaded onto the website as part of scrolling banners etc...
I have fortunately met somebody who can provide me with personalised T Shirts, and Caps which I will personally sign and send.
For the people who make REALLY big contributions :), I promise to send all of the above as well to include their names on a special page in the translated book.
If the book ever gets made into a movie special mention will be made of these people. They will also get cameo roles if it is possible.
I believe that this project is going to be amazing but in the sad event that the goals are not met, I will still stay in touch with the people who contributed, keep the money safe and keep using other avenues to raise additional funds to realise the dream..... 

  The Impact Imagine a world where people are given the opportunity to reach their full potential. 
Imagine a world where people are not judged on their gender, race, ethnicity or beliefs but rather on the attitude they have to other people and the environment.   
Imagine a world where people stand shoulder to shoulder and respect each others differences.                                                                                                                                 
Imagine a world of love and peace.
Ghandi said "Be the change you want to see." 
I believe that we can all inspire the people around us and these little drops of positivity can add add up and become a wave of change that takes us closer to a better world. 
This book is just a part of what I see as our contribution to inspiring dreams and positive thought...

  Risks & Challenges
Like any venture, there are inherent risks involved and I will try my best to minimise these.
I have identified suitably qualified translators in South Africa so we can interact on a personal basis while I research my next book.
I have partnered with a group of Medical Doctors in South Africa who are committed to social development and who will be assisting me with some of the marketing aspects surrounding the book.
I plan to distribute the book as an ebook as well as a hardcopy and when the demand becomes sufficient, I am open to partnering with other parties to facilitate delivery.

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you are reading this then you can help!!! I understand that not everybody is able to contribute financially but please tell your friends, family, colleagues (and everybody else!) about this project. 
Please feel free to add my links to your websites and post on social media. Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools! 
You can get in contact with me if you want to contribute in any other way, or think I may be able to assist you with any project you are involved in.

story:
My name is Laura Burlton and I am a mother of two beautiful daughters and a photographer. I have been working with my daughters for several years making artworks, and most recently my series "Chalk Dreams" which I have been working on since 2008, mostly with my daughter Sadie.  This campaign is to fund a school trip for Sadie. She has inspired me since birth and is an all around awesome being. Sadie would really like to go on a trip to Washington DC with her classmates this coming Spring Break, so I told her we would raise some funds. After all, She contributes so much to my personal work, I feel it is the least I can do. 

We are trying to raise $1000 for the trip itself, plus a little extra cash for spending money. Any extra funds will go toward materials for extending our Chalk Dreams project, and if there are enough extra funds, I may go along to chaperone the trip ( but that is another $1400)

With various contributions, I will be giving away different photos from my archives. With large enough donations, I will give limited edition prints ( to preserve the integrity of the collections already in progress of my work, these will not be discounted). I will also be offering custom Chalk Portraits in the Houston, Texas area So think of it as an art sale for a good cause!

Of course, if we do not raise enough funds, I will still reward her with something special ( like a pair of Doc Martins) but I think the memories she will make on this trip are priceless. So please help her go!

Every little bit helps and if you cannot contribute, help spread the word!


Thanks, 

Laura and Sadie

story:
Greetings Family, Friends, and Community,

    As many of you know, I am the mother of a very special 7 year old boy, who I adopted through foster care. We have been together since he was 10 months old.
    This summer I was reflecting a lot on what it means to be a mother, and the bond between mother and child that is so strong, it's hard to describe. I thought back to when I first decided to be a foster parent, and though I was mostly met with loving and understanding support, I was also questioned about how I could raise a child who came from someone else, and feel that bond, with the well meaning sentiment that it's not something that most people could do.

    Well the bond is there, and it IS thick. Thicker Than Blood.

    When I meet other adoptive families, I am always inspired and proud, feeling an instant bond, as if we know each others joys and struggles. Of course everyone's story is unique, but with this photographic project, I want to share the connection and my appreciation, by highlighting the many families who I have met on this journey. My 15 year old niece, a budding photographer, and I will capture the beauty and love of the diversity that makes up adoptive families.

    With your support, we will be able to share images of these dynamic families and spread the joy and special bond that adoption brings, in hopes to inspire others.


      What We Need

      Our goal is to raise $1100 to support this project:

      • $500 ($250 each) to cover the cost of a 6 week photography workshop starting at the end of October. We both are pretty good with the camera, but we want to be assured that we will walk away from the special time with a family, and know we have some shots worth sharing .
      • $400  ($40 each) to cover the cost of 10 photo books to be given to the participating families.
      • $200 to cover the printing and framing for the exhibit


      Other ways to help

      We understand you may not be able to contribute financially:

      • Please feel free to share this fundraiser with others
      • Look for our exhibit (coming in Spring)
