story:
Defying Gravity

"He climbs highest who lifts another up" - George Matthew Adams

Defying gravity is a local group started by four women who feel passionately about rock climbing and bouldering. We want to foster a love of climbing in our local youth and all the positive things that go with it, including a sense of community, pride and confidence, love of the sport, and stewardship for the land. Instilling these values in our climbing youth will provide a stronger climbing community for future generations

This campaign was launched specifically to assist in funding the things necessary to build and sustain a strong youth climbing community and competitive bouldering team in Missoula, MT. The first thing we need to be able to do is become a recognized non-profit by filing our tax documents. The funds raised here will be used to pay the filing fees.

Climbing is becoming quite the elite sport and we'd like to help offset the high cost of climbing team membership by raising funds. This can help reduce the cost to the families and kids so that membership to the climbing team can be a reality for any interested child, regardless of family income.

What We Need and What You Get:

  • We would like to raise at least $400 prior to the next competitive season in order to file our tax documents to become a 501c3.

  • What you get when you donate:

    • The wonderful feeling to know that you are contributing to the future of climbing by fostering a love of climbing in children
    • The warm and fuzzy feeling of knowing you are contributing to confidence, team atmosphere, and the healthy activity in our youth

Even if we do not reach our entire goal, we will contribute every dollar raised to benefit our climbing kids and cover as much of the above described costs as possible.

The Impact

Contributing to this campaign can make a huge difference in a child's life.

  • Many of the kids on our team are very independant thinkers and don't fit with the traditional sports team. This team is like no other! These kids are fiercely competitive, as much with their own best climbing as with other climbers. At the same time, they support every climber they've ever met and especially each other! They build a strong community of young climbers across Montana and across the Western US.
  • These kids are the future of our climbing community and need our support to continue to thrive!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate directly, please share on your website, twitter, facebook, and any other means possible! And remember that every share and and every dollar makes a difference!

story:
Summary: Call to Change. 

Hello! 

My name is Elena Lipsiea and I am currently a high school senior in St. Cloud, MN. I have been invited to participate in Thinking Beyond Border's Global Gap Year program. This amazing opportunity will allow me to experience multiple international cultures and critically analyze world issues. I am incredibly passionate about using my life for meaningful change and know that this unparalleled, educational program will provide me with the critical tools to do so. It is my belief that once one sees how they can impact the world they no longer have an excuse to stand still. I am challenging YOU to challenge me through your donations. Your investment in the unveiling of my eyes will demand that I use my life as an agent of change.

Costs: Breaking Boundaries.

Total Cost: $30,000 tuition + airfare (approx. $5,000)

Expensive? Yes. Attainable? Absolutely!

Why?

For every $1 I raise, Thinking Beyond Borders will match an additional $2. 

If I am able to raise my goal of $10,000, TBB will then match the remaining $20,000. 

The Investment: Itinerary & Details.

By investing in my call to change you will enable me to experience TBB's amazing program .

This includes:

Thirty weeks of personal and educational growth through: home stays, fieldwork with local experts, language learning, academic study, and independent travel opportunities. 

  • Orientation in Ecuador – 2 weeks
  • Ecuador – Natural Resources – 5 weeks
  • Enrichment: Peru – Trek to Machu Picchu – 1 week
  • Thailand – Sustainable Agriculture – 6 weeks
  • Enrichment: Cambodia – Angkor Wat – 1 week
  • India – Education – 5 weeks
  • Enrichment: India – Pushkar Camel Trek – 1 week
  • South Africa – Public Health & the AIDS Epidemic – 5 weeks
  • Enrichment: South Africa – Addo Safari – 1 week
Culmination in Washington, D.C. – 3 weeks

The last stage of the program (Washington, D.C.) will allow my fellow students and I to present what we have learned before our friends, families, and educators. This final chapter will act as a catalyst to our futures, as we forge our paths of global impact.

Your Call: Other Ways to Help.

Although this campaign is monetarily based, you CAN help me reach my goals without opening your wallet. Spreading the word about my personal mission and funding goals is equally important. Share the word on social networks, via E-mail, or via phone to let those you know about my campaign! Your gift of time is just as appreciated as what you are able to give financially. Whatever you feel able to give, I thank you with the utmost sincerity. 

Thank you, thank you, thank you.

story:
Howdy,

The Resource Centre team is made up of local and international volunteers who are taking part in the UK's International Citizenship Service for the NGO International Service and working together with the permanent staff of the Resource Centre. 

The Resource Centre for Persons with Disabilities also unifies and represents:

  • Ghana Society of the Physically Disabled
  • Ghana Blind Union
  • Ghana Association of the Deaf
  • Association of Parents and Guardians of Children with Disabilities

We are determined to use our time together as efficiently as possible to work towards our goals, one of the most important of which is to provide information about and challenge stigma surrounding disability issues in the Northern Region of Ghana.
Everybody has different abilities and disabilities, some being more or less noticable than others, and we believe that nobody should be defined by or discriminated against because of these. However some of the main debilitators for persons with disabilities the world over are ignorance, misinformation, prejudices and discrimination.
From our research and the personal experience of some of the members of the Resource Centre it is apparent that society is still unfortunately relatively ignorant on disability issues here and many negative connotations remain attached to those persons living with a disability.
For example there is still a common belief that disability is a curse given to the person because of their or their family's actions and even when this is not the case, people with disabilities are not generally seen as equally capable members of society. Statistics show they find it harder to find work and many make a living by begging. 
These prejudices are passed along through society many times and the family/community to those living with a disability so that they feel ashamed and consider themselves as useless to society and/or their families. 
You can help us to try and change this!!
We realise there are many fundraisers out there and it's impossible to give something to them all. We can't say ours is more important, but we can promise that the money you give is going towards a project which is happening now and which we are overseeing directly. Nothing will be wasted: what you give, no matter the amount will be spent on something tangible, on-going and sustainable which will have long-lasting results: we will be able to provide evidence of this to you.
We are running a region-wide sensitization programme to a range of communities and schools (primary, secondary and Special schools) which include a variety of activities, an interactive presentation full of information on disabilty and soon, with your help, videos of para-sports, short films and documentaries on disability.
After our last sensitization programme we realised how hard it is to describe to a person who has never heard of para-sports what they involve and how they are played. In the same way it is hard to get a room of people to envisage the amazing feats of somebody with a disability and their courage in the face of adversity through words alone. 
"A picture tells a thousand words"  
And we believe a video can tell a million. We are passionate endorsers of the power of image and the persuasiveness of documentary film. 
One of the things we want to show is the UK made "Superhuman Paralympics Campaign", not only so the people here can appreciate what these individuals achieved despite and because of their "disability", but also to encourage the youth of Ghana to take part in para-sports themselves.
We also want to show "Emmanuel's Gift", a true and inspiring story of a Ghanaian orphan with one leg who rode across the nation of Ghana to spread his message.

We agree with Nelson Mandela that:

"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world."

And for this reason we believe this programme can have a huge and lasting impact in the communities we reach. 
So please help us to raise the money to get our Projector. The 500 dollars (300 pounds) we raise will go towards getting a projector to show the films, speakers, and a hard copy of the Sensitization Programme to leave at each school for their future use.
The Resource Centre is an entity which functions independantly and will carry on the Programme even if the ICS scheme ceases in the future, We are carrying out the Sensitization programme with the permanent members of staff who will carry on giving it long after the UK volunteers have left.
In return for your generosity we have offered various perks such as photos, videos, updates and mentions in the blog. Anybody can like our facebook page to get regular updates at https://www.facebook.com/NRRCPWDGhana
Please help us to share our message and reach the target before the deadline!!
Thank you for reading,
The Resource Centre Team.
story_txt:
Howdy,The Resource Centre team is made up of local and international volunteers who are taking part in the UK's International Citizenship Service for the NGO International Service and working together with the permanent staff of the Resource Centre. The Resource Centre for Persons with Disabilities also unifies and represents:
Ghana Society of the Physically Disabled
Ghana Blind Union
Ghana Association of the Deaf
Association of Parents and Guardians of Children with Disabilities

We are determined to use our time together as efficiently as possible to work towards our goals, one of the most important of which is to provide information about and challenge stigma surrounding disability issues in the Northern Region of Ghana.
Everybody has different abilities and disabilities, some being more or less noticable than others, and we believe that nobody should be defined by or discriminated against because of these. However some of the main debilitators for persons with disabilities the world over are ignorance, misinformation, prejudices and discrimination.
From our research and the personal experience of some of the members of the Resource Centre it is apparent that society is still unfortunately relatively ignorant on disability issues here and many negative connotations remain attached to those persons living with a disability.
For example there is still a common belief that disability is a curse given to the person because of their or their family's actions and even when this is not the case, people with disabilities are not generally seen as equally capable members of society. Statistics show they find it harder to find work and many make a living by begging. 
These prejudices are passed along through society many times and the family/community to those living with a disability so that they feel ashamed and consider themselves as useless to society and/or their families. 
You can help us to try and change this!!We realise there are many fundraisers out there and it's impossible to give something to them all. We can't say ours is more important, but we can promise that the money you give is going towards a project which is happening now and which we are overseeing directly. Nothing will be wasted: what you give, no matter the amount will be spent on something tangible, on-going and sustainable which will have long-lasting results: we will be able to provide evidence of this to you.We are running a region-wide sensitization programme to a range of communities and schools (primary, secondary and Special schools) which include a variety of activities, an interactive presentation full of information on disabilty and soon, with your help, videos of para-sports, short films and documentaries on disability.After our last sensitization programme we realised how hard it is to describe to a person who has never heard of para-sports what they involve and how they are played. In the same way it is hard to get a room of people to envisage the amazing feats of somebody with a disability and their courage in the face of adversity through words alone. "A picture tells a thousand words"  And we believe a video can tell a million. We are passionate endorsers of the power of image and the persuasiveness of documentary film. One of the things we want to show is the UK made "Superhuman Paralympics Campaign", not only so the people here can appreciate what these individuals achieved despite and because of their "disability", but also to encourage the youth of Ghana to take part in para-sports themselves.We also want to show "Emmanuel's Gift", a true and inspiring story of a Ghanaian orphan with one leg who rode across the nation of Ghana to spread his message.
We agree with Nelson Mandela that:
"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world."And for this reason we believe this programme can have a huge and lasting impact in the communities we reach. So please help us to raise the money to get our Projector. The 500 dollars (300 pounds) we raise will go towards getting a projector to show the films, speakers, and a hard copy of the Sensitization Programme to leave at each school for their future use.
The Resource Centre is an entity which functions independantly and will carry on the Programme even if the ICS scheme ceases in the future, We are carrying out the Sensitization programme with the permanent members of staff who will carry on giving it long after the UK volunteers have left.In return for your generosity we have offered various perks such as photos, videos, updates and mentions in the blog. Anybody can like our facebook page to get regular updates at https://www.facebook.com/NRRCPWDGhana
Please help us to share our message and reach the target before the deadline!!Thank you for reading,The Resource Centre Team.

story:
We are two Juilliard music students who met in New York and teamed up with a shared passion for teaching and outreach.  Dima was born and raised in Bulgaria and Charlotte is originally from Maryland.


What is the Ostinato Project?

The Ostinato Project was created by Dima and Charlotte as a two-part community service program to be implemented in Bulgaria in June 2014.  One component brings innovative arts education to orphans, who are notoriously underserved and left without sufficient educational or recreational resources.  The other aspect of the project pairs students from the National Academy of Music in Sofia (Bulgaria) with local hospices to bring music to patients who greatly need it while encouraging a spirit of community outreach amongst the next generation of musicians.   


Orphanage Arts Program

In June 2014, we will travel to three orphanages to lead group activities rooted in music and the arts to foster self-confidence, expression, respect, and a joyful learning attitude.  Through the age-appropriate games we have designed, we will address the emotional, social, and educational needs of the children by engaging them in activities that help them discover their creative capabilities.  We will focus on developing each child’s confidence by creating a supportive environment where they can share and express their feelings.  Our program includes elements of music, physical activity, culture and geography, visual art, improvisation, guided imagery, poetry, and acting.  Some of our favorite activities include Peace Recipe, Draw Your Dream, Rain Game, Mapping the World, Music in Colors, and Reflection + Sharing Time!

Each orphanage visit will culminate in a group performance to provide a positive emotional outlet and strengthen a sense of teamwork amongst the children.  In addition, we will simply be showing attention and affection to the disabled children at each orphanage while bringing a bit of fun to their lives with the music we play and the opportunity for them to make music with us.  


Why Orphans?

Orphanages in Bulgaria are understaffed and in abysmal condition with poor hygiene, nutrition, and educational resources.  Children in these orphanages are deprived of the care and attention essential to their growth, worsening their emotional problems, social problems, and learning difficulties.  Caregivers struggle to provide children with basic needs for food and shelter and have little energy or resources to meet the childrens’ educational and emotional needs.  Children in orphanages often do not finish middle or high school due to a lack of resources, educational materials, or support system. 


Do the Arts Really Have the Power for Social Change?

Creating a safe environment through arts education develops the self-confidence and improved academic skills these kids need.  Music education programs improve listening skills, memory, motor skills, and language abilities. Music is therapeutic for children with emotional and social problems, and aids in social interactions between children.  Participation in group activities fosters teamwork, cooperation, and a sense of community.  Music and arts activities emphasize our shared humanity and lay a foundation for more tolerant, compassionate perspectives in children.  When children are offered the tools to express themselves positively through the arts, they develop healthier mental and emotional habits.  Besides, music is fun!



Hospice-Conservatory Partnership

While in Bulgaria in June 2014, we will collaborate with students from the National Academy of Music in Sofia to present three interactive performances in three local hospices.  The hospice patients will benefit from hearing live music and interacting with the performers, while the students will be introduced to new ways of giving back to their community through music and taking charge of their creative and career development.  The interactive entertainment programs that provide comfort and joy for healthcare patients in America are nearly non-existent in Bulgaria, particularly in the capital’s hospices.  Without any type of outreach programs, patients experience neither the relief that music can bring to their situation nor the feeling that they are not forgotten.  


Why Conservatory Students? 

Conservatory students at Sofia’s National Academy of Music are rapidly declining in number and the ones who do graduate cannot find employment opportunities in their field, leading to a sense of apathy.  Receiving little exposure to the idea of musical outreach, students are unaware of their potential to bring music to those who need it most.  In today’s situation, students’ creative ideas are stifled and healthcare patients miss out on the wonderful benefits music could bring to their otherwise difficult daily lives.

We have designed a workshop for the conservatory students to share the ideas we have gained from our frequent interactive healthcare and hospital performances. The students will be offered a small stipend in return for their services.

We have opened a conversation with the Dean of the conservatory about the benefits of such a program for the students and will do our best to ensure the continued success and self-sufficiency of the Hospice-Conservatory partnership. We are in the process of finding funds to make this partnership operate on a monthly basis.  


The Impact 

Through our Orphanage Arts Program and Hospice-Conservatory Partnership, we strive to emphasize the concept of arts outreach and service in Bulgaria, which will encourage and create new opportunities for Bulgarians to revitalize their own communities.


Building on Successful Outreach Models

Our project aims to implement outreach models we have become familiar with through our work with various community service organizations into the Bulgarian community.  We have extensive experience in diverse teaching and outreach performance settings.  Most notably, we are inspired by community service initiatives that send groups of conservatory students into healthcare facilities with more accessible, engaging programming than a typical concert format.  Our experiences teaching through organizations that give music instruction to underserved  youth and in team-teaching arts-based programs has convinced us of the importance of improving personal growth and respect amongst students.  Please see our short bios below for more info on our prior outreach and teaching experiences!


Dima Dimitrova

A native of Bulgaria, Dima Dimitrova is a devoted teacher and performer. Dima attended the National School of Music in Sofia until moving to the U.S. at the age of fourteen to study at Idyllwild Arts Academy in California.  She completed her undergraduate studies at The Juilliard School in New York City, where she is pursuing her Master of Music degree.  During her time at Juilliard, Dima has regularly presented interactive concerts in hospices and senior centers around New York.

Dima has taught at various schools in New York City and is currently on the faculty at Opus 118 Harlem School of Music, the program that was featured the movie, Music of the Heart.  She has also led a program called “Introduction to Violin” at a public school, during which she has taught group lessons to kindergarteners.  Her colleagues frequently seek her out as a substitute teacher for the Music Advancement Program at The Juilliard School, Midori and Friends, as well as at Church Street School of Music and Art.  Dima has been a two-time member of the program Musicians for Salvador, a two-week exchange program in Salvador da Bahia, Brazil.  With twelve Juilliard students, she worked primarily with NEOJIBÀ, a project based on the highly successful Venezuelan program ‘El Sistema' providing a comprehensive, two-week orchestral training seminar for the students of NEOJIBÀ, including private lessons, master-classes, sectionals, and a side-by-side performance. The team also worked with charity organizations and orphanages (IBCM and Pracatum School) in the Salvador Community and raised $4,000 to donate to two orphanages through benefit performances in Salvador.  She has been involved in the Bulgarian community in New York City since 2008 and is currently on the Executive Board of the series, “Bulgarian Concert Evenings in New York.”  


Charlotte Steiner

Charlotte is a student at The Juilliard School with an active teaching schedule and a strong commitment to community engagement, including her participation in the Juilliard New Orleans ARTreach project for two years.  In New Orleans, Charlotte’s experiences team-teaching after-school classes of multi-disciplinary arts activities convinced her of the positive impact arts education can have in children’s lives.  Most noticeably, watching the program’s students courageously stretch their creativity and expression in a cumulative performance was a wake-up call to using arts activities as a vehicle for teaching.  

Two academic years of leading a class of fifth-grade viola students at a public school in New York City have equipped Charlotte with an understanding of how to balance differing learning styles and attention spans.  Charlotte has also been a counselor at both music and regular summer camps for children.

As a Juilliard Gluck Community Service fellow, Charlotte has collaborated with her peers to present interactive performances in healthcare facilities throughout New York City.  With experience playing in children’s hospitals, palliative care units, and rehabilitation units, she has become comfortable with presenting unique programming in non-traditional performance venues.  In addition to her participation in the Gluck program, she has performed as a volunteer soloist at psychiatric wards, children’s hospitals, and nursing homes.  

Charlotte maintains a studio of private violin and viola students, and is currently a faculty member at Opportunity Music Project, a non-profit strings program that provides private lessons to New York City youth with an emphasis on student-led community service performances.  The responsibilities she holds as a faculty member include teaching weekly private lessons to children, leading orchestra sectionals, and assisting with studio classes.  

Charlotte is fortunate enough to have appeared on Sesame Street as part of a string ensemble, which boosts her street cred with her students!


Why Bulgaria?

Bulgaria is Europe’s poorest nation, despite its European Union membership. The current political and economic climate in the country has left Bulgaria’s 7 million citizens distrustful of their government and hopeless for change. Without a spirit of volunteerism or knowledge of the value of helping those in greatest need, Bulgaria misses out on community outreach and engagement programs that have the potential for addressing the urgent needs of its citizens.  

Dima’s observation of the current situation for classical musicians in Bulgaria and her fluency in Bulgarian will allow for direct communication and cultural understanding during our project.


What We Need

Donations of any amount will make a difference for a child who needs arts education, a conservatory student who needs inspiration, or a hospice patient who needs emotional relief.

While we have already successfully raised funds for the cost of our flight, we are still in need of donations for:

  • Instruments for children, including tambourines, maracas, and guiros

  • Art supplies for children, including crayons, paper, tape to hang drawings on the walls of the orphanage, pencils, and notebooks.

  • Local transportation (bus, train) between Sofia and small villages

  • Accommodation outside of Sofia

  • Stipend for Sofia conservatory students involved in Hospice-Conservatory Partnership


How much do things cost?

Because the items we need are sold so cheaply in Bulgaria, even very small contributions will make a big impact.  Here are some of our small expenses: 

$2 provides a tambourine for a child at an orphanage!

$4 helps us get to an orphanage. (Literally, a round-trip ticket from Sofia to a rural town costs only $4.)

$10 supplies a world map for an orphanage.

$30 buys notebooks for children at one orphanage.

$40 provides enough crayons for an entire orphanage.

$50 provides a generous stipend for a conservatory student in return for their hospice performance.


Any donations received after reaching our goal will be divided equally between providing school supplies for a needy orphanage and contributing to the Hospice-Conservatory Partnership artist stipend fund.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you know someone involved with the Bulgarian musical community who might be able to assist our project, please let us know!

Please send our Indiegogo page to your friends and relatives, or use the sharing tools to post to social media sites.


Thank you for reading about the Ostinato Project!  We hope you are as excited as we are about the potential the arts have for positive change in the Bulgarian community.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Bradley Van Egeren. I am an eighth grader at DCS Montessori school in Castle Pines, Colorado. We are a very small school with only 32 students, and our teachers have offered us eighth graders an amazing experience. They have scheduled a trip to the real United Nations building in New York! This is a once in a lifetime opportunity that I do not want to miss. This is very important to me because I will never again get to go into the building and act as a delegate of the world. I will also meet other Montessori students from around the world! This is not only an educational opportunity, but a chance to socialize with people living on the opposite side of the world.

As you might have guessed, it is a very expensive trip from Colorado to New York. It will cost $1,500 to go on the trip, which I am afraid my family won't be able to afford if I do not get funding. If I get donated even close to this amount, I will be very grateful and will most likely still be able to go on the trip! I have also decided that if you donate $10.00 or more, you will get access to all the photos that I take at the real UN building in New York, or you can donate $20.00 or more and get to suggest what I talk about in my blog as long as it's related to my studies!

As a unique perk to go along with this campaign, every one will have access to my personal blog. I will do a daily blog talking about what I worked on concerning the Model UN during the day. In my blog I will also include insight and thoughts about the Model UN. I thought that this would be a unique way to show other schools the work it takes, as well as the unique experience. My daily blogs will eventually lead up to my 4 day long trip in New York, where I will also do blogs.

Here is the link to my blog:    http://mymodelunitednation.blogspot.com/

story:
Lampedusa In festival - Storie di Migranti e Progetti di Resistenza

C'era una volta un isola di soli 24 Km² che riposava nella parte bassa del Mediterraneo. Un giorno l’allora Ministro degli Interni del Governo Italiano decise che un centro di detenzione per migranti non era abbastanza e propose di costruirne un secondo. La popolazione locale si ribellò e dalle ceneri di quella rivolta nacquero due ambiziosi progetti di resistenza creativa: l'Associazione Askavusa e il Lampedusa In Festival. Questa e' piu o meno la storia che da allora si narra nelle notti d'inverno, quando fuori, il Maestrale soffia forte.

Il Lampedusa In Festival, giunto alla sua VI edizione, vuole continuare a trattare argomenti quali la migrazione, le libertà civili e gli effetti della globalizzazione sulla società, attraverso dibattiti aperti e forme d'arte quali il cinema, il teatro, la musica, la letteratura, etc. Per garantire l' indipendenza ideologica e politica dell'evento, e quindi un alto livello di denuncia, negli anni si è scelto di utilizzare, sempre di più, forme di finanziamento dal basso. Così arriviamo ai giorni nostri e al perchè ci troviamo qui.

Chi siamo 

Askavusa é un collettivo nato nel Marzo del 2009 a Lampedusa, dopo le proteste contro la creazione di un secondo centro detentivo per migranti. Nel corso degli anni, il collettivo si é impegnato sul territorio organizzando attivita' politico-culturali e per la promozione del territorio. Allo stesso tempo ha portato avanti un intenso lavoro di denuncia circa cause e conseguenze dei fenomeni migratori che attraversano il Mediterraneo. Assieme al festival, il collettivo ha da tempo portato avanti un lavoro di raccolta e conservazione di oggetti rinvenuti sui barconi usati dai migranti per attraversare lo stretto di Sicilia, e che a Lampedusa sono arrivati. Questo ha dato vita a PortoM: un esposizione permanente del passaggio e delle storie di migliaia di esseri umani sull'isola di Lampedusa. 

Perche' Contribuire

Il Lampedusa in Festival e' un evento culturale che vuole raccontare storie troppo spesso dimenticate, conservando la memoria del Mar Mediterraneo e di tutto quello che rappresenta: punto d'incontro e di rottura tra mondi vicini e lontani.

Col tuo contributo potrai aiutarci a portare avanti questo lavoro, a tramandare le vicende degli abitanti di questa piccola isola e di tutti quelli che qua sono passati e passeranno. Per supportare la nostra indipendenza  vi chiediamo di finanziare - anche con un piccolo gesto - questo progetto, permettendoci di dare voce sia ai migranti che agli abitanti di Lampedusa, luogo di cui tutti parlano ma che nessuno ascolta.

Come contribuire 

Ogni anno il festival viene ideato e realizzato grazie all'impegno del collettivo Askavusa e all’aiuto di amici ed attivisti. Ci sono però costi che non possono essere evitati, come l'accoglienza degli ospiti, l'affitto della strumentazione tecnica, la promozione, etc.

Per continuare a fare tutto ciò abbiamo bisogno di TE!

Il tuo contributo verrà utilizzato per coprire le seguenti spese:

2000 euro: trasporti per gli ospiti ed alloggi

1500 euro: affitto service ed altra strumentazione tecnica

1000 euro: digitalizzazione materiale audio visivo dell' archivio del festival

500 euro: promozione

Altri modi per aiutare

Condividere e far conoscere la nostra campagna Indiegogo!

Diffondere il bando e le informazioni sulla manifestazione!

Venire al festival!!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Lampedusa In Festival - Stories of Migrants and Projects of Resistance

Once upon a time there was an island of just 24 square kilometres, resting at the bottom of the Mediterranean Sea. One day, the Minister of the Interior  of the Italian Government decided that a detention centre for migrants was not enough, and proposed to build a second one. The local population rise up and from the ashes of that revolt  two ambitious projects of creative resistance born: the Askavusa Collective and the Lampedusa In Festival. This is more or less the story that is told from then on winter nights, when out, the Mistral, blows strongly.

The Lampedusa In Festival, now in its sixth edition, wants to continue to address topics such as migration, civil liberties and the effects of globalisation on society, through open debates and forms of art such as cinema, theatre, music, literature, etc.. To ensure the ideological and political independence of the event, and therefore a high level of complaint, over the years we have chose to use, more and more, forms of financing from the bottom. So we come to the present day and why we are here. 

About Us

Askavusa is a Collective born in March 2009 in Lampedusa, after protests against the creation of a second detention centre for migrants. Over the years, the collective committed itself to organising political and cultural activities as much as promoting the resources of the territory. At the same time it carried on an intensive critique about the causes and consequences of migration crossing the Mediterranean. Along with the festival, the collective has long carried out a work of collection and preservation of objects found on the boats used by migrants to cross the Sicilian Channel. This meticulous work has seen its natural outcome in PortoM: a permanent exhibition of the passage and the stories of thousands of human beings on the island of Lampedusa.

Why to contribute

The Lampedusa In Festival is a cultural event that aims to tell stories too often forgotten, preserving the memory of the Mediterranean Sea and all what it represents: a meeting point between worlds near and far.

With your contribution you will help us to continue this work, to pass on the stories of the inhabitants of this island and of all those who have reached this shore, and moved away. To support the festival to retain its independence, we ask you to finance - even with a small gesture - this project, allowing us to give voice to both migrants and residents of Lampedusa, a place that everyone talks about, but no one really wants to listen to.

How to contribute

Every year the festival is conceived and realised through the efforts of the Askavusa Collective and the help of friends and activists. However, there are costs that can not be avoided, such as the reception of guests, the rental of technical equipment, promotion, etc..

To continue to do everything we need YOU!

Your contribution will be used to cover the following expenses:

€ 2000: transport and accommodation for guests

€ 1500: to rent the service and other technical equipment

€ 1000: digitization of audio-visual materials of the festival

€ 500: promotion

Other ways to help

Share and promote our Indiegogo campaign!

Spread the publication and the information about the event!

Come to the festival!!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Lampedusa In Festival - Histoires de migrants et Projets de résistance 

Le Lampedusa In Festival, engagé dans sa VIème édition, est organisé par le Collectif Askavusa, établi à Lampedusa. Le Festival traite des migrations, des libertés civiles et des effets de la mondialisation sur la société, à travers des débats ouverts et l'art dans ses diverses manifestations: cinéma, théâtre, musique, littérature,etc. 

Afin de garantir notre indépendance idéologique et politique, et de manière générale notre liberté de dénonciation, nous faisons appel aux méthodes de financement participatif.

Qui sommes-nous? 

Askavusa est un collectif né en mars 2009 à Lampedusa, suite aux mobilisations contre la création d'un second centre de rétention sur l’île. Au fil des années, le Collectif s'est engagé dans l'organisation d'activités politico-culturelles sur le territoire lampedusain ainsi que pour la promotion de ce territoire. En même temps, le Collectif s'applique à signaler et relayer les causes et les conséquences des phénomènes migratoires en Méditerranée. Outre le Festival, Askavusa collecte et conserve également des objets retrouvés sur les barques utilisées par les migrants pour traverser le Canal de Sicile. C'est ainsi qu'est né l'espace dénommé Porto M: un lieu d'exposition permanent du passage et des histoires de milliers d’Êtres humains à Lampedusa. 

Pourquoi contribuer

Le Lampedusa In Festival est un évenement culturel, un lieu d'échanges et de partage, de part et d'autre de la mer Méditerranée.

Votre participation est essentielle afin de maintenir l'indépendance de nos actions et de nos activités visant à donner la parole aux migrants et aux habitants de Lampedusa, - lieu dont tout le monde parle mais que personne n'écoute.

Comment contribuer

Chaque année, le Festival est mis en œuvre grâce à l'investissement du Collectif Askavusa, de ses amis et d'activistes. Mais certaines dépenses ne peuvent être évitées, telles l'accueil des invités, la location des outils techniques, la promotion, etc.

Pour cela, nous avons besoin de vous!

Vos contributions seront employées de la manière suivante: 

3000 euros: transport des invités et hébergement

1500 euros: location de services et autres outils techniques 

500 euros: promotion

Autres possibilités d'agir

Pour celles et ceux qui souhaitent tout de même appuyer nos activités, vous pouvez:

Partager et faire connaître notre campagne!

Diffuser l'appel à films et les informations sur l'événement!

Venir au Festival!!

story:
250 million children in the world can't read, write, and perform arithmetic. We are here to change that, but we need you.

The Global Learning XPRIZE is a competition to build Open Source software to teach a child to read, write, and perform arithmetic, by themselves, without a teacher. Teams will compete to win a $15 million reward to build this revolutionary technology.

But this is not enough. We want to bring this technology to more kids in more villages, to test and improve it, to build a global community committed to eradicating illiteracy and create a world more peaceful and more prosperous.

You can help by contributing what you can and by joining our movement.


The Roddenberry Foundation kindly contributed $100,000 to our campaign and this has inspired us to explore new frontiers and add a stretch goal of $750,000!

This revised goal will help us to bring this revolutionary technology to even more kids in even more parts of the world and build a strong and empowered global movement that seeks to eradicate illiteracy. We need you to help us to spread the word to hit this new goal!



This is the only place where you can get an opportunity to have EARLY ACCESS TO THIS REVOLUTIONARY SOFTWARE over 18 months before anyone else. See the perks!


E x p l o r e   M o r e

We Need You  · The Perks · How the Money is Used
Win a Trip to Visioneering · Join Our Community · 10 Ways to Help
About XPRIZE · FAQ

F e a t u r e d    I n

"[This XPRIZE] is amazing and it is putting power in the hands of people who need it the most."

– CNN

"If XPRIZE were to achieve such an ambitious goal, it wouldn’t be the first time."

– WIRED

"It could go a long, long way toward tackling the chronic shortages of schools and teachers that ultimately hurt kids' futures."

– Engadget

"If this new prize competition lives up to its early promise, we could be talking about a radically new approach to education within our lifetime."

– Washington Post


Imagine a world where every child has the opportunity to grow and prosper, where education, technology, and knowledge are open to them, to help them be the best they can be. Without reading, writing, and arithmetic skills, this world is locked away. Books...the Internet...Wikipedia...wider education...all of this needs to be unlocked with literacy.


We are creating a movement, a global community of scientists, developers, advocates, designers, translators, artists, and more. We want you to be part of this movement and to put your brick in the wall in eradicating illiteracy and unlocking those minds.

We have an awesome range of perks available including getting EARLY ACCESS TO THE SOFTWARE 18 months before anyone, be able to vote on , view, or attend visioneering where future XPRIZEs are created, be able to sponsor a village, get awesome swag, get a unique custom 3D printed Global Learning XPRIZE phone case designed by seven-time grammy-award rapperand philanthropist, Will.i.am, and more!

We don't just want you to back the campaign though, we want you to join our community and be a part of making history.

We have a referral contest where you can win an all-expenses paid trip to visioneering where we create future XPRIZEs, we are building a global family to work together to support the prize and campaign, and we have 10 awesome ways in which you can help our campaign today!


We’ve put together an exciting set of perks around our mission and the Global Learning XPRIZE.

$10: SUPPORTER package

Show your support of the Global Learning XPRIZE and get the following:

  • Website Credit - your name will be added to http://learning.xprize.org to demonstrate your support for the Global Learning XPRIZE.
  • Digital Certificate - we will send you a digital certificate that you can use to show your support for the campaign.

$25: EARLY ACCESS package

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate

In addition to this, you will get early access to the software 18 months before the world sees it.

Get access to this revolutionary educational software so you can run it on your own Android tablet and test it with kids in your area.

This will get your hands on technology that could have a profound global impact, months before anyone else gets to use it.

It doesn't stop there...you will also get:

  • Extended Digital Content - as part of the crowdfunding campaign we will be releasing special digital content including material from celebrities such as Seth Green, Sir. Richard Branson, George Takei, Tony Robbins, and more!
  • Visioneering Vote - get a vote at the next Visioneering event to determine what future XPRIZEs are!
  • Credit in the Software - your name will be added to the winning software solution as a credit.


$25: SIGNED TIM FERRIS BOOK package


Our generous friend and supporter, Tim Ferriss, has offered to sign 100 copies of his book, the New York times best-seller, The 4-Hour Chef. Ferriss uses cooking to teach “meta-learning,” a step-by-step process that can be used to master anything, whether searing steak, speaking Spanish, or shooting 3-pointers in basketball.

This perk includes one signed print copy of the book, complete with shipping.

Thanks to Jayson Gaignard from MastermindTalks for the kind contribution of the books and Tim Ferriss for signing them.


$50: ADVOCATE package

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Early Access to the Software
  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate
  • Visioneering Vote
  • Credit in the Software
  • Extended Digital Content

In addition to this, you will also get a Global Learning swag bag which includes an awesome Global Learning XPRIZE t-shirt, stickers, and a wristband.

You will also get live video streaming access to our visioneering event where you can watch as future XPRIZEs are designed, discussed, and debated. This, combined with your vote at visioneering provides a wonderful opportunity to influence what future XPRIZEs look like.


$150: FUTURIST EARLY ACCESS package

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Early Access to the Software
  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate
  • Visioneering Voting
  • Credit in the Software
  • Extended Digital Content
  • Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
  • Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering

We have partnered with 3D Systems and to create a custom designed, limited edition, Global Learning phone case (or statue if you prefer). This case is 3D printed, using cutting-edge technology, and custom designed by seven-time grammy-award rapper, entrepreneur, and philanthropist, Will.i.am.

Note: The design is still under development, and we will be revealed later.

This case is available for the following handsets:

  • iPhone 4,
  • iPhone 5
  • iPhone 6
  • Samsung Galaxy S5
  • Galaxy Note 3
  • Google Nexus 5
If you don't have one of these handsets (or you do and prefer an alternative) you will be sent a 3D printed statue that is perfect for sitting on your desk, coffee table, or elsewhere!
In addition to this you will get 2 early-access copies of the software!

$250: INNOVATOR package

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Early Access to the Software
  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate
  • Visioneering Voting
  • Credit in the Software
  • Extended Digital Content
  • Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
  • Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering
  • Limited Edition 3D printed phone-case/statue
In addition to this you will be sent the revised edition of the New York Times Bestselling book, Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.


$1,000: EDUCATION package

Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:

  • Early Access to the Software
  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate
  • Visioneering Voting
  • Credit in the Software
  • Extended Digital Content
  • Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
  • Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering
  • Limited Edition 3D printed phone-case/statue
  • Copy of Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think, signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.

In addition to this you will get early access to the software for your school. This will include 20 copies of the software that you can test, use, and explore with kids in your local area.

This does not require usage at a school: if you would prefer to purchase this perk for another group such as scouts, clubs, societies, user groups, or others, that is welcomed!


$10,000: DATE WITH DESTINY package

Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:

  • Early Access to the Software
  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate
  • Visioneering Voting
  • Credit in the Software
  • Extended Digital Content
  • Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
  • Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering
  • Limited Edition 3D printed phone-case/statue
  • Copy of Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think, signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.

In addition to this you will get a ticket to the incredible Date With Destiny event, organized and run by Best Selling Author, Entrepreneur and Philanthropist, Tony Robbins.

Tony contributed $1 million dollars to help fund the Global Learning XPRIZE, and also contributed this perk. Thank-you, Tony!

This perk also includes a photo and meet-up with Tony.


$10,000: VIP package

Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:

  • Early Access to the Software
  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate
  • Visioneering Voting
  • Credit in the Software
  • Extended Digital Content
  • Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
  • Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering
  • Limited Edition 3D printed phone-case/statue
  • Copy of Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think, signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.

In addition to this you get 2 VIP tickets to both Global Learning XPRIZE award ceremonies. Dates for these events will be announced later.

These will be exclusive events with the teams, donors, celebrities, and public figures that have made the Global Learning XPRIZE possible. This will be a unique and remarkable opportunity to meet these people, network, and form future relationships.

Please note: travel and accommodation is not included.


$10,000: VILLAGE SPONSOR package

Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:

  • Early Access to the Software
  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate
  • Visioneering Voting
  • Credit in the Software
  • Extended Digital Content
  • Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
  • Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering
  • Limited Edition 3D printed phone-case/statue
  • Copy of Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think, signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.

In addition to this, your contribution will sponsor a village and help provide the solar generators, equipment, transport, materials, and infrastructure to get the finalists' solutions into the hands of real kids in real villages.

The effects of this perk are profound: it provides a means in which practical testing and results can help the teams to make more and more improvements and ensure the overall output of the Global Learning XPRIZE is the best it can be.

When this testing has been completed, we will also send you a framed certificate acknowledging your sponsorship of a village, and which village you sponsored.


$25,000: AMBASSADOR package

Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:

  • Early Access to the Software
  • Website Credit
  • Digital Certificate
  • Visioneering Voting
  • Credit in the Software
  • Extended Digital Content
  • Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
  • Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering
  • Limited Edition 3D printed phone-case/statue
  • Copy of Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think, signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.

In addition to this you will be recognized and identified as a top-tier sponsor of the Global Learning XPRIZE initiative. This is a small and select group and you will be recognized at both award ceremonies.

This perk also includes a ticket to our visioneering event in person, where future XPRIZEs are discussed and proposed. This is an exclusive event with public figures, business leaders, celebrities and others attending. This will provide a hands-on opportunity to be a part of influencing the future grand challenges we work to solve with XPRIZE!


Every dollar that you pledge will go towards supporting the Global Learning XPRIZE to ensure it is as successful and impactful as possible. Here’s how your money will and won’t be used.

The money will be used in four primary areas:

  • Wider testing with more kids in more towns and villages – we want to ensure the software created by teams gets as much testing and feedback in the field as possible. Your contribution will fund the equipment, infrastructure, and transport to test the finalists with more kids in more towns and villages.
  • Helping teams to be successful – the success of the teams that compete in this prize are critical to our overall success. Your contribution will help create an environment for teams to be successful, including infrastructure, events, development resources, and more. With the Open Source nature of this prize, this is particularly important as teams have an incredible opportunity to collaborate around common problems.
  • Creating a global community – beyond the teams that are participating, we are growing a global community at XPRIZE to solve the grand challenges of our time. Your contribution will help create this community by providing tools, merchandise, materials, community events, collaboration facilities, and more. You can already see the beginning of this community forming at http://forum.xprize.org - come and join us!
  • Creating an Open Source educational technology – the winning team and the four runner-ups will all have their technology fully Open Sourced. This will create a remarkable educational foundation available to everyone and one that can grow and evolve long past the conclusion of the Global Learning XPRIZE. Your contribution will be an investment in open education, as well as ensuring that the technology can live and grow when the prize concludes.

Importantly, your money will NOT be used in the following areas:

  • The prize purse.
  • XPRIZE staff salaries and offices.
  • Funding teams to do their work.
  • Fundraising activities and events.

If you have any further questions or queries about how the money is spent, feel free to share your questions on http://forum.xprize.org. 



Visioneering is an annual event that the XPRIZE Foundation runs to bring together experts, business leaders, celebrities, politicians and more to discuss our grand challenges and construct XPRIZEs to solve them.

It is an eclectic, exclusive group, with previous attendees including Arianna Huffington (founder, Huffington Post), James Cameron (director), Larry Page (co-founder, Google) and Eric Schmidt (chairman, Google), Sir Richard Branson (founder, Virgin), Paul Allen (co-founder, Microsoft), and others. We want to add your name to this list.

We have an awesome opportunity for you to win an expenses-paid trip to Visioneering that takes place from May 6 - 8, 2015 at Terranea Resort in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, USA. Not only can you win this fantastic prize, but you can also help spread awareness of the campaign and our efforts to combat illiteracy!

The winner will also receive an exclusive limited-edition XPRIZE jacket, t-shirt, and cap:


How To Participate

To win, we are running a referral competition in which the person who raises the most awareness of the crowdfunding campaign and gets the most people to visit this Indiegogo page will win the trip.
The runner-up will get the exclusive XPRIZE jacket, t-shirt, and cap.
Participating is simple:
  1. If you don't have an Indiegogo account, go and register one by clicking here. When you are finished, come back to this page.
  2. At the top of this page use the share buttons to share this campaign with others. You can use the social media buttons, but also the Link button to generate your unique web link that points to this page. This link helps us to ensure we register that you referred the person to this page. Be sure to use these links...they include the information needed for us to register your referrals!
  3. Each time you share the campaign with these links we will track them in a running tally. We will regularly update everyone with the current rankings each week in our campaign updates.
  4. Importantly, we are awarding the prize to the person who gets the most people visiting this page, so try to spread the word as far and wide as you can! Every person who clicks on your link gets you a step closer to coming to Visioneering and helps raise awareness about a truly valuable campaign!
FIND OUT MORE DETAILS OF HOW TO PARTICIPATE AND SOME TIPS AND TRICKS!
In addition to this, the top 5 people who raise money for the campaign will also get EARLY ACCESS to the software for their schools!

XPRIZE is an innovation engine. A facilitator of exponential change. A catalyst for the benefit of humanity.

We believe in the power of competition. That it’s part of our DNA. Of humanity itself. That tapping into that indomitable spirit of competition brings about breakthroughs and solutions that once seemed unimaginable. Impossible. We believe that challenges must be audacious, but achievable, tied to objective, measurable goals. And understandable by all.

We believe that solutions can come from anyone, anywhere and that some of the greatest minds of our time remain untapped, ready to be engaged by a world that is in desperate need of help. Solutions. Change. And radical breakthroughs for the benefit humanity.

We’ve already facilitated oil recovery cleanup at quadruple the standard rate. Enabled the creation of a 102.5 MPGe energy-efficient car. We helped launch a $2 billion private space industry. Soon you will have healthcare in the palm of your hand.


Community is at the heart of the Global Learning XPRIZE and we are building a global community that will work together to help this incredible opportunity to bring literacy to children across the world.

We don't just want you to support the campaign by getting a perk, we want you to be a part of making history.

We are building a community of advocates, developers, teachers, scientists, business-people, artists, designers, translators and more. This community is coming together to bring their skills and talents to the table; we believe that everyone can put their brick in the wall to eradicating global illiteracy.

We have only just started, and we already have a global spread:

This community is forming on a brand new forum that helps us to get to know each other, brainstorm, collaborate on projects, and more! It is a shared family, passionate about bringing real, practical change to the world.

Come and join the growing XPRIZE family now at http://forum.xprize.org


There are many ways in which you can play an essential role in the success of the Global Learning XPRIZE:

  1. Contribute! - a great place to start is to buy one of our awesome perks. Scroll up to find out more!
  2. Join the Community - come and meet the new XPRIZE community at http://forum.xprize.org and share ideas, brainstorm, and collaborate around new projects.
  3. Refer Friends and Win Prizes - want to win an expenses-paid trip to our Visioneering event where we create new XPRIZEs while also helping spread the word? To find out more click here.
  4. Download the Street Team Kit - head over to our Get Involved page and download a free kit with avatars, banners, posters, presentations, FAQs and more. The page also includes videos for how to get started!
  5. Create and Share Digital Content - we are encouraging authors, developers, content-creators and more to create content that will spread the word about literacy, the Global Learning XPRIZE, and more!
  6. Share and Tag Your Top 5 Children's Books - which children's books have been the most memorable for you? Share your Top 5, complete with a link to

    http://igg.me/at/learningxprize and tag 10 friends to share theirs too! When using social media, be sure to use the #learningprize hashtag.

  7. Show Your Pride -  go and download the Street Team Kit and use the images and avatars in there to change your profile picture and banner on your favorite social media networks (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, Google+).
  8. Create Your 'Learning Moment' Video - record a video and share on a video website (such as YouTube) about how learning has really impact your life. Give the video the title "Global Learning XPRIZE: My Learning Moment". Be sure to share your video on social media too with the #learningprize hashtag!
  9. Put Posters up in Your Community - go and download the Street Team Kit, print the posters out and put them up in your local coffee shops, universities, colleges, schools, and elsewhere!
  10. Organize a Local Event - create a local event to share the Global Learning XPRIZE. Fortunately we have a video on our Get Involved page that explains how you can do this, and we have a presentation deck with notes ready for you to use!
Remember, if you have questions, be sure to join the XPRIZE community at http://forum.xprize.org


Why are you doing this?
This Indiegogo campaign is designed to further enhance the community, team collaboration, practical field-trials and testing, and other areas that are part of the Global Learning XPRIZE. We believe the power is in our community, but not just in the teams who create the technology to win the prize, but many other people who want to play a role in solving this grand challenge.

Crowdfunding is a great way in which the general public can help contribute towards making the Global Learning XPRIZE as successful as it can be both in terms of raising resources as well as raising awareness. We believe that everybody, from our backers on this campaign, to teams, to members of our new community, can make a real difference.

Why the $500,000 $750,000 figure?
After breaking down the costs of the many moving parts associated with deploying, testing, and tracking this technology as well as with establishing a global, Open Source community, infrastructure, and platform for the winning solution, our team determined that this money will cover many of these initial costs.  

This is really just the first step. The more we raise, the more we can do – let’s raise 10x that this amount so we can further facilitate success of this the Global Learning XPRIZE. Help us spread the word!

How do we know this XPRIZE will be successful?
As with every XPRIZE, the prize design team has consulted with a global team of experts in structuring the requirements for how the prize operates. This process takes into account the growth of technology, where we expect technology to be in the next five years, the extent of the problem (e.g. how many kids can’t read, write, and perform arithmetic today), and how attractive this would be to prospective teams.

With these exhaustive considerations accounted for, we are very confident that the Global Learning XPRIZE is going to net incredible results. If we didn't have confidence in this, we wouldn't launch this XPRIZE in the first place.

Also, be sure to take a look at the history of XPRIZE. We incentivized the commercial space-flight industry, revolutionized oil cleanup technology, and are on the verge of putting affordable healthcare in the palm of your hand. All of the lessons learned from previous XPRIZE competitions and how they operate will benefit this, our newest, grandest prize.

How much money from the crowdfunding actually goes to the prize?
With the exception of the Indiegogo/FirstGiving fees, every dollar goes towards the campaign.

What payment methods do you accept?
We accept major credit cards.

Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely!

When will my perk prizes be delivered?
We are currently estimating shipping in December 2014.

I love what you are doing! How can I help?
Great question! Go and see the 10 ways in which you can help, all listed above. Also be sure to come and join the community at http://forum.xprize.org and find out more.

Is shipping included in the perks?
Yes.

Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
Yes.

I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse the prize or help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you?
Please email Jono Bacon, our Sr. Dir. Community who can discuss this further with you.
story_txt:
250 million children in the world can't read, write, and perform arithmetic. We are here to change that, but we need you.The Global Learning XPRIZE is a competition to build Open Source software to teach a child to read, write, and perform arithmetic, by themselves, without a teacher. Teams will compete to win a $15 million reward to build this revolutionary technology.But this is not enough. We want to bring this technology to more kids in more villages, to test and improve it, to build a global community committed to eradicating illiteracy and create a world more peaceful and more prosperous.You can help by contributing what you can and by joining our movement.The Roddenberry Foundation kindly contributed $100,000 to our campaign and this has inspired us to explore new frontiers and add a stretch goal of $750,000!This revised goal will help us to bring this revolutionary technology to even more kids in even more parts of the world and build a strong and empowered global movement that seeks to eradicate illiteracy. We need you to help us to spread the word to hit this new goal!This is the only place where you can get an opportunity to have EARLY ACCESS TO THIS REVOLUTIONARY SOFTWARE over 18 months before anyone else. See the perks!


E x p l o r e   M o r e
We Need You  · The Perks · How the Money is UsedWin a Trip to Visioneering · Join Our Community · 10 Ways to HelpAbout XPRIZE · FAQ

F e a t u r e d    I n




"[This XPRIZE] is amazing and it is putting power in the hands of people who need it the most."
– CNN


"If XPRIZE were to achieve such an ambitious goal, it wouldn’t be the first time."
– WIRED


"It could go a long, long way toward tackling the chronic shortages of schools and teachers that ultimately hurt kids' futures."
– Engadget


"If this new prize competition lives up to its early promise, we could be talking about a radically new approach to education within our lifetime."
– Washington Post




Imagine a world where every child has the opportunity to grow and prosper, where education, technology, and knowledge are open to them, to help them be the best they can be. Without reading, writing, and arithmetic skills, this world is locked away. Books...the Internet...Wikipedia...wider education...all of this needs to be unlocked with literacy.

We are creating a movement, a global community of scientists, developers, advocates, designers, translators, artists, and more. We want you to be part of this movement and to put your brick in the wall in eradicating illiteracy and unlocking those minds.
We have an awesome range of perks available including getting EARLY ACCESS TO THE SOFTWARE 18 months before anyone, be able to vote on , view, or attend visioneering where future XPRIZEs are created, be able to sponsor a village, get awesome swag, get a unique custom 3D printed Global Learning XPRIZE phone case designed by seven-time grammy-award rapperand philanthropist, Will.i.am, and more!

We don't just want you to back the campaign though, we want you to join our community and be a part of making history.
We have a referral contest where you can win an all-expenses paid trip to visioneering where we create future XPRIZEs, we are building a global family to work together to support the prize and campaign, and we have 10 awesome ways in which you can help our campaign today!








We’ve put together an exciting set of perks around our mission and the Global Learning XPRIZE.
$10: SUPPORTER package



Show your support of the Global Learning XPRIZE and get the following:



Website Credit - your name will be added to http://learning.xprize.org to demonstrate your support for the Global Learning XPRIZE.

Digital Certificate - we will send you a digital certificate that you can use to show your support for the campaign.



$25: EARLY ACCESS package
Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):



Website Credit

Digital Certificate



In addition to this, you will get early access to the software 18 months before the world sees it.

Get access to this revolutionary educational software so you can run it on your own Android tablet and test it with kids in your area.
This will get your hands on technology that could have a profound global impact, months before anyone else gets to use it.
It doesn't stop there...you will also get:




Extended Digital Content - as part of the crowdfunding campaign we will be releasing special digital content including material from celebrities such as Seth Green, Sir. Richard Branson, George Takei, Tony Robbins, and more!

Visioneering Vote - get a vote at the next Visioneering event to determine what future XPRIZEs are!


Credit in the Software - your name will be added to the winning software solution as a credit.



$25: SIGNED TIM FERRIS BOOK package



Our generous friend and supporter, Tim Ferriss, has offered to sign 100 copies of his book, the New York times best-seller, The 4-Hour Chef. Ferriss uses cooking to teach “meta-learning,” a step-by-step process that can be used to master anything, whether searing steak, speaking Spanish, or shooting 3-pointers in basketball.
This perk includes one signed print copy of the book, complete with shipping.


Thanks to Jayson Gaignard from MastermindTalks for the kind contribution of the books and Tim Ferriss for signing them.



$50: ADVOCATE package
Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):


Early Access to the Software

Website Credit

Digital Certificate
Visioneering Vote

Credit in the Software

Extended Digital Content

In addition to this, you will also get a Global Learning swag bag which includes an awesome Global Learning XPRIZE t-shirt, stickers, and a wristband.


You will also get live video streaming access to our visioneering event where you can watch as future XPRIZEs are designed, discussed, and debated. This, combined with your vote at visioneering provides a wonderful opportunity to influence what future XPRIZEs look like.



$150: FUTURIST EARLY ACCESS package







Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):



Early Access to the Software
Website Credit
Digital Certificate
Visioneering Voting
Credit in the Software
Extended Digital Content
Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)

Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering



We have partnered with 3D Systems and to create a custom designed, limited edition, Global Learning phone case (or statue if you prefer). This case is 3D printed, using cutting-edge technology, and custom designed by seven-time grammy-award rapper, entrepreneur, and philanthropist, Will.i.am.


Note: The design is still under development, and we will be revealed later.
This case is available for the following handsets:


iPhone 4,
iPhone 5
iPhone 6
Samsung Galaxy S5
Galaxy Note 3
Google Nexus 5

If you don't have one of these handsets (or you do and prefer an alternative) you will be sent a 3D printed statue that is perfect for sitting on your desk, coffee table, or elsewhere!
In addition to this you will get 2 early-access copies of the software!



$250: INNOVATOR package


Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):


Early Access to the Software
Website Credit
Digital Certificate
Visioneering Voting
Credit in the Software
Extended Digital Content
Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering
Limited Edition 3D printed phone-case/statue
In addition to this you will be sent the revised edition of the New York Times Bestselling book, Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.







$1,000: EDUCATION package
Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:


Early Access to the Software
Website Credit
Digital Certificate
Visioneering Voting
Credit in the Software
Extended Digital Content
Swag Bag (inc. T-shirt, stickers, and wristband)
Live Video Streaming Access to Visioneering
Limited Edition 3D printed phone-case/statue
Copy of Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think, signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.

In addition to this you will get early access to the software for your school. This will include 20 copies of the software that you can test, use, and explore with kids in your local area.
This does not require usage at a school: if you would prefer to purchase this perk for another group such as scouts, clubs, societies, user groups, or others, that is welcomed!



$10,000: DATE WITH DESTINY package




Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:


Early Access to the Software

Copy of Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think, signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.

In addition to this you will get a ticket to the incredible Date With Destiny event, organized and run by Best Selling Author, Entrepreneur and Philanthropist, Tony Robbins.

Tony contributed $1 million dollars to help fund the Global Learning XPRIZE, and also contributed this perk. Thank-you, Tony!

This perk also includes a photo and meet-up with Tony.



$10,000: VIP package

Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:


Early Access to the Software

Copy of Abundance: The Future Is Better Than You Think, signed by XPRIZE founder, Peter Diamandis.

In addition to this you get 2 VIP tickets to both Global Learning XPRIZE award ceremonies. Dates for these events will be announced later.
These will be exclusive events with the teams, donors, celebrities, and public figures that have made the Global Learning XPRIZE possible. This will be a unique and remarkable opportunity to meet these people, network, and form future relationships.
Please note: travel and accommodation is not included.



$10,000: VILLAGE SPONSOR package
Get all of the perks at $250 and below plus:


Early Access to the Software
Website Credit

Visioneering Voting

Remember, if you have questions, be sure to join the XPRIZE community at http://forum.xprize.org







Why are you doing this?This Indiegogo campaign is designed to further enhance the community, team collaboration, practical field-trials and testing, and other areas that are part of the Global Learning XPRIZE. We believe the power is in our community, but not just in the teams who create the technology to win the prize, but many other people who want to play a role in solving this grand challenge.
Crowdfunding is a great way in which the general public can help contribute towards making the Global Learning XPRIZE as successful as it can be both in terms of raising resources as well as raising awareness. We believe that everybody, from our backers on this campaign, to teams, to members of our new community, can make a real difference.
Why the $500,000 $750,000 figure?After breaking down the costs of the many moving parts associated with deploying, testing, and tracking this technology as well as with establishing a global, Open Source community, infrastructure, and platform for the winning solution, our team determined that this money will cover many of these initial costs.  
This is really just the first step. The more we raise, the more we can do – let’s raise 10x that this amount so we can further facilitate success of this the Global Learning XPRIZE. Help us spread the word!
How do we know this XPRIZE will be successful?As with every XPRIZE, the prize design team has consulted with a global team of experts in structuring the requirements for how the prize operates. This process takes into account the growth of technology, where we expect technology to be in the next five years, the extent of the problem (e.g. how many kids can’t read, write, and perform arithmetic today), and how attractive this would be to prospective teams.
With these exhaustive considerations accounted for, we are very confident that the Global Learning XPRIZE is going to net incredible results. If we didn't have confidence in this, we wouldn't launch this XPRIZE in the first place.
Also, be sure to take a look at the history of XPRIZE. We incentivized the commercial space-flight industry, revolutionized oil cleanup technology, and are on the verge of putting affordable healthcare in the palm of your hand. All of the lessons learned from previous XPRIZE competitions and how they operate will benefit this, our newest, grandest prize.
How much money from the crowdfunding actually goes to the prize?With the exception of the Indiegogo/FirstGiving fees, every dollar goes towards the campaign.
What payment methods do you accept?We accept major credit cards.
Can I donate from outside the USA?Absolutely!
When will my perk prizes be delivered?We are currently estimating shipping in December 2014.
I love what you are doing! How can I help?Great question! Go and see the 10 ways in which you can help, all listed above. Also be sure to come and join the community at http://forum.xprize.org and find out more.
Is shipping included in the perks?Yes.
Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?Yes.
I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse the prize or help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you?Please email Jono Bacon, our Sr. Dir. Community who can discuss this further with you.

story:
As a vivacious twenty-five year old, Tiffany Marie Neff was an angel who left us too soon.  Tiffany was one who loved life and took full advantage off all opportunities.  She marched to her own drum, but everyone who met Tiffany loved her and her gracious and spirited personality.  Due to an ongoing illness, we lost Tiffany to suicide one spring afternoon.

Tiffany was an intelligent, beautiful and accomplished woman. After years of endless hard work, Tiffany finally landed her dream job working on a US Senate political campaign.  Tiffany’s job was very demanding, however, she always made the time to reach out to others and dedicated much of her time to helping those in need.  At the time of her passing on March 25, 2012, Tiffany was very involved in various clubs and programs, which dealt with working with those in need of guidance and support. Tiffany’s passion for education led her to help those less fortunate attain a strong educational background, by volunteering her free time as a tutor and helping children refine their study skills and prepare for college entrance exams.

Tiffany was a well-rounded child who came from a multicultural family.  She was the first child to be inducted into the world wide martial arts hall of fame at the age of seven years old and continued to excel as an athlete later lettering in varsity cross country, track and basketball at her beloved high school, Gilmour Academy.

Tiffany’s enthusiastic and competitive attitude carried over into every aspect of her life. She was truly grateful for the life long friends and education she received from Gilmour Academy.  But it is said that every person has a demon, and Tiffany’s demon was an eating disorder, which began during her adolescent years.  After years of prevailing over her eating disorder and living a very successful, happy life, she had succumb to the pressures of her demon once again, to the point she could no longer fight.

Tiffany left family, friends, and colleagues all to ask the questions why, what could we have done to prevent this horrific tragedy, and how do we go on from here? Tiffany devoted much of her life to helping others, and now we will continue on in Tiffany’s Way. 

So in honor of Tiffany Marie Neff, we have created the Tiffany's Way Foundation and are looking for donations of any amount to help start a scholarship to send one student to Gilmour Academy in the fall of 2014.
