story:
Hi my name is Laura. I am a high school student. I have been given the opportunity to study abroad in JAPAN for one year. I am saving up funds for the cost of my travel, my stay in the host country, my classes and equipment. The approximate cost of this wonderful adventure is $15,000. My experience abroad would open my mind to the new language, culture and will benefit me academically. I would stay in my host country for one whole year studying art.This is a once in a life time opportunity. I'd be immersed in new foods, new culture, and new artistic experienced I will never forget. I would really appreciate those who can contribute. Thank you and god bless.  

The program I am in is AFS. Link: http://www.afsusa.org/

The risks and challenges of this program is losing all my money.

story:
Our Story

My name is Monique and I am the mother of this amazing gymnast, Marissa. For the past three years, Marissa has been apart of the Farmington United Gymnastics high school team and each year of being on the team she has improved and advanced in the difficulties of her tricks. Marissa also coaches at her gym where she first trained to be a  gymnast but once school starts, she only makes enough to pay for gas to whomever she can get a ride with to practice and work because I work a second job and can not take her to work. Each year the fees for being a part of this team increases and as a single parent of two teens and working two jobs to make ends meet, it is difficult to have any extra to get these fees paid in time for her to compete and train as well as this year she will be joining the YMCA High school team, where she began her gymnastics training, to try for some of the college scholarships that they offer. Unfortunately, colleges no longer look at high school senior gymnast for scholarships they look at those seniors in club gymnastics and I can't afford club.
This being her senior year, there are not only fees for gymnastics but all the other fees that come along with being a senior such as college application fees, senior dues, senior pictures, etc. I am asking for help so that she will be able to do the one thing that she loves most and may be able to get a scholarship for college.
With your help, she will be able to continue to train and compete her senior year without stressing over wether or not her fees were paid and if she can stay on these teams.
Marissa is a great gymnast and with extra training, she can be at the top of her game. Please help me!

What We Need 

We need at least $1500. 

  • $350 Pay to play Farmington Public School fee for sports.
  • $350 transportation
  • $240 fall training
  • $290 YMCA training fee
  • $120 competition Leotard
  • $150 competitive meets
Help with these fees will leave Marissa unstressed and able to compete at her best her senior year.

    This Means the World to Marissa!!!

story:
A Bit of Big City in our Home Town

Most of us have traveled for work or fun, enjoying a light meal and adult beverage in wonderful little locations.  How often have you said to yourself "I wish we had this back home, I'd go all the time!"?

  • Here is your chance to make this happen.  A cozy lounge with pristine service, high end spirits, epicurean light meals and jazzy appeal is in the making.  Located in the well lit and safe uptown section of Timmins, close to offices, parking and public transportation. Supporting local musicians, food providers and artists.  Training staff to be the best they can be now and for anywhere they go in their career.
  • Let's create a grown up, classy place to celebrate successes, meet friends and entertain clients.

By purchasing your membership to The Luxe Library, you will, not only get in on a fabulous new venture, you'll also help offer your friends, colleagues and neighbours a little bit of Big City right here in our own back yard.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce a high quality, safe and exclusive lounge, the project requires $100,000 in start up funds, which will be used as seed money for the balance of the funding.  Total overall cost of this important project is $350,000.

  • First step is the construction.  A long bar that will sit 20, full bar back wall to feature the premium spirits, 40 foot wide wall of bookshelves with inlaid fireplaces, raised stage and well laid out kitchen.  Next is the equipment and stock – providing delicious, healthy, locally sourced foods/meals that are never deep fried or bought frozen in bulk requires top of the line equipment.
  • By sponsoring $1500 or more, you automatically become a Card Carrying V.I.P. member, with renewal extended to July 2016.  The Luxe Library will be open to the public evenings and weekends, but only V.I.P.’s can access and sign in guests during the work days (12:00 – 5:00), as well the V.I.P.’s are the only patrons able to make reservations and will receive exclusive deals and event invitations.  Be a part of this amazing group!
  • Understanding that while this opportunity is exciting and unique, the total goal may not be acquired through our crowdfunding campaign – Christina Geddes will also be meeting with private investors, finance companies and government agencies to ensure no detail is put aside due to lack of funds.

The Impact

Unsure a lounge like The Luxe Library will work in Timmins?

  • According to marketing surveys over the last few years, the number of folks who feel this is a place they would gladly support a few times a month if not more often matched the statistical percentage of our community who is influential, employed and currently spending money out of town. A resounding number of comments left were demanding a great new lounge with great service and safe location was needed.
  • This project is a work of passion for Christina Geddes – Timmins born, Christina has worked in many careers in Timmins, always coming back to hospitality.  Her fundraisers and themed events have garnered her much respect.  Examples are – Dedicated Divas fund raising events (wine tasting, comedy show, blues concerts); Rotary Club events (Ribfest bar tent, Club appreciation evening, Lobsterfest); Northern College Pub events (Apprentice Party Planner, Awesome Ladies Club Evening); and events partnered between The Fishbowl and Luxe Entertainment (Scotch Tasting, Gypsy Night, Mardi Gras, Piano Lounge). All of these events were successful and well attended.
  • With in-house security/hosts, amazing servers, passionate chefs and local musicians, this is the place you will want to wind down, celebrate and cement business deals.

Risks & Challenges

Unicorns and Fairies may be a myth, as is guaranteed success of a new, unique business in a small northern town that has typically only supported meat and potato restaurants and beer and wings bars in the past.  The solid confidence that The Luxe Library will succeed is based on six years of market research, trial and error and community feedback. Combined with a determination, drive and focus, the right people involved that can make this work and a solid strategy we are confident this can be THE place everyone will continuously support.  To keep people walking through the doors, the business plan includes:

  • Six months of planned events, booked musicians and seasonally themed foods.
  • Consistent experience – from the greeting to the basic menu, you will learn that you can expect the same amazing experience today, next month and three years from now.  You will learn to depend on weekly schedules of live music, drop-in amateur evenings and private event closures – consistently.
  • Community support – the art for sale on the walls/shelves, the food served, some of the spirits featured, the musicians on stage – locally sourced.  A portion of profits will go to The SpeakEasy Emporium non-profit group to help local artists and businesses get a healthy start.

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps sponsoring is not a reality for you at this time, and we understand.  If this is where you are at, but still want to support this project, please contact us to discuss how you can help get the word out there. 

·  Share this campaign through e-mails and social media. See the Indiegogo share tools to make it simple.

·  Connect us with local artists and musicians.

·  Plan fundraising events with our event planning team.

·  Add the Luxe Library to your places to go – make us a habit!

story:
The NEC Society 

The NEC Society strives to protect premature and fragile infants from necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC), an intestinal disease with an extraordinarily high morbidity and mortality rate. We accomplish our mission by: 

  • Empowering families 
  • Collaborating with clinicians and researches 
  • Urging NICUs to implement best practices, known to reduce fragile infants' risk of developing NEC 

Preemie Parent Alliance (PPA) Membership 

The NEC Society has been invited to join the PPA, which represents and supports organizations dedicated to empowering parents of preemies. You can learn more about the Preemie Parent Alliance here. 

  • We need $500 for a two-year membership in to the PPA.
  • Membership will allow the NEC Society to reach more families impacted by NEC. We believe that when families are empowered and informed of the risks of NEC, they are in a better position to protect and advocate for their fragile infant. 
  • If we do not raise enough funds for a two-year membership into the PPA, we will use the funds to either fund a one-year membership or to increase fragile infants' access to human milk, which reduces their risk of developing necrotizing enterocolitis by nearly 80%. 
  • If we raise more than $500, all funds will be directly used to reduce fragile infants' risks of developing NEC. 

PPA Membership: Strengthening the NEC Society 

By joining the PPA, the NEC Society will: 

  • Join and network with dozens of organizations focused on supporting parents of preemies 
  • Gain access to thousands of parents of preemies 
  • Receive consultation on professional development 

    Other ways to support the NEC Society 

    If you cannot support the NEC Society's PPA membership, you can still help! 

    • Know a NICU family? Make sure they know about the NEC Society
    • Share this with your network! 

    Thank you!

story:
Montessori Infant Nido Environment (MINE) is a year round, Organic, Montessori School. The MINE mission is to provide a nurturing, home-like educational environment for the very young wherein they are encouraged and supported to do the important lifework of becoming a fully developed, whole person who is aware of individual, environmental, and community responsibilities.

  

Over many years of raising my own children, teaching in Montessori schools, and studying Montessori philosophy and child development, I formed a vision of a school that integrated the fundamental aspects of Maria Montessori’s vision for child education with the foundational qualities of human kindness, environmental stewardship, mutual trust, and community engagement to create a school that embodied all that I wished was available when my children were young. 

   

I opened the doors to MINE, in August 2013, serving 5 children in my home...

  

...but then something amazing happened. As I shared my vision of MINE with others, they started volunteering their time, creativity, services, and resources. They gave of these things freely because they, like me, believed in the potential of raising the standards and value of childcare and education for the very young and the MINE vision grew into what it is now: a year-round, all-natural, organic Montessori school for children ages 8 weeks through 6 years. 

   

The current plan for MINE includes organic and vegetarian meals and snacks, organic cloth diapers for the younger children, organic linens for every child, and all-natural materials in every classroom. Eventually MINE will become a 501c3 Not-For-Profit school.

 

MINE has Isla the school dog and Bleu the school cat with whom the children learn to develop positive relationships with animals. An organic seed-to-table experience, environmental responsibility, and peace-building are woven into the daily curriculum.

   

Most importantly, the school is being created to serve as a community resource for children, parents and families. Partnering with local farmers, furniture makers, child specialists, midwives and pediatricians, and various organizations that serve children, MINE and its teachers will be a supreme advocate for children and parents while supporting the local community. 


Additionally, once off the ground, the MINE Food Program will be refined to create a template and act as a resource to help implement and support an organic, seed-to-table culinary curriculum in group childcare programs across the nation.

The goal of the co-creators and supporters of MINE is to change to culture of how we think about, what we expect, and how we regard educational experiences for children from birth to three years.


This campaign is to financially support the collection of talented teachers, passionate and committed parents, and interested community members that have joined together to push Montessori Infant Nido Environment to the next level. 

This campaign will change the lives of local children, parents and families, and will help create a change-agent for the greater culture to re-value the first three years of children's lives, their parent's experiences, the worth of their caregivers, and the significance of their daycare/preschool experience.


What we need

The $25,000 is needed to expand the school to serve not 5, but 50 young children while maintaining the vision and goals of the school.

•  A portion of the funds will help us secure the building needed to expand.

•  A portion will be used to purchase Montessori materials for the classrooms and furnish each classroom with child-sized chairs, tables and other classroom furniture from local businesses that support local carpenters.

•  A portion of the funds will be used to purchase lumber needed to build a wooden climbing structure, an extension of the roof to provide an outdoor classroom so the children can work and play outside in inclement weather, as well as sand for the playground.

•  A portion of the funds will help set up partnerships and relationships with local farmers to source food and create farming mentorship programs for the children and the school. This portion will include purchasing local fruit trees, berry bushes, vegetables, herbs and bee-attracting flowers for the MINE garden.

•  A portion of the funds will go towards the documentation and codification of the process of setting up an all-natural, organic school for the purpose of creating a template for other daycares and preschools.

If we don’t reach our campaign goal of $25,000, the money donated will still go towards the expansion of the school and programs and initiatives in the order listed above.


What you get!

(The exciting perks are described here in detail. To choose them, use the perk links on the right-hand side of your screen)

Montessori Infant Nido Environment offers some unique perks for your contributions. Our perks reflect the MINE philosophy and mission of stellar Montessori education infused with an organic seed-to-table experience, peace-building, and creating green habits curriculum while supporting the local community.

Everyone who donates gets a personal shout out of thanks on the MINE Facebook page!

Additionally, if you wish to remain anonymous and decline any incentive gift, of course we will honor that.

$10 – “A Very MINE Thank You”

A hand decorated thank you card from the MINE students. Each card is an original, designed by the children using an array of art materials of their choosing. Even the infants will get involved! 

$25 – “MINE Nature and Narration…LOL!”

A piece of nature that children collected on our daily nature walks around the neighborhood with a short narration to you from the child who chose the piece of nature. The children tend to collect sticks, pine cones, rocks, flowers, plants, dirt, bean pods, moss, etc. If it catches their interest, they put it in the nature bucket. The narration will be what they decide to tell me about the item when asked about why they chose it. The narrations will be humorous, silly, and usually completely unrelated! No matter what your narration message says, we promise it will bring a smile to your face and a great conversation piece!

$40 – “MINE is Isla and Bleu Too!”

An original Isla the MINE dog and Bleu the MINE cat paw print art piece. Isla and Bleu are dear members of the MINE classroom. They are loving and affectionate to the children providing opportunities for developing positive relationships with animals. Bleu hangs out napping all day in teacher chairs. Isla practices sitting while the children are around. She loves getting huge cuddles from the children and often serenades us during meals. Both are featured on the MINE website and in the various MINE social media outlets. Isla is even in the fundraising video you just watched!!

$50 – “A MINE Original Nature Flower Pot”

An original MINE nature flower pot. Each pot is an original, made from a recycled tin can and decorated with different bits of nature collected by the children on our daily walks. We use them in the classroom to display fruit and vegetable plants that we have regrown from scraps or planted from leftover apple or melon seeds from snacks or meals. They are distinctive and interesting to look at.

$100 – “At MINE, Difference is Normal”

MINE’s original “Difference is Normal Matching Work” and a description of the story of why it is in the classroom, as well as MINE’s pedagogical reasons for having it in the classroom.

$175 – “MINE Montessori Infant Gift Set”

A 3-piece Infant Montessori gift set with developmental explanations for each piece written by an AMS certified Montessori Infant/Toddler teacher. A handmade, Montessori-inspired, bell on a ribbon mobile, a natural wooden teething ring, and a mini MINE-inspired nature mobile. These are wonderful for your own young ones and also make wonderful one-of-a-kind baby shower gifts.

$250 – “That’s MINE Part of the Garden”

A fruit tree, berry bush, patch of herbs, group of bee-attracting flowers, or row of vegetables in the MINE vegetable garden donated in your name. Your donation area will be marked with a MINE-inspired garden sign with your name on it. 

$300 – “THE MINE Original Nature Mobile”

An original MINE nature mobile. Each mobile is hand-made by MINE teachers and children. These mobiles are truly beautiful. They are not always for infant handling, but they will enrich any room you decide to hang it.

$500 – “MINE Thanks You…Forever”

A permanent virtual declaration of thanks on the MINE Facebook page and MINE website thanking you for your support.

$1000 – “MINE for the Day” + complimentary “MINE Thanks You…Forever”

A guided tour of the school followed by a leisurely local, organic lunch with the MINE Director, MINE Director of Nutrition, MINE Chef and MINE teachers, complete with a MINE-inspired 5-item gift box. Enjoy great conversation, food, and company!

$3000 – “MINE for the Night” + complimentary “MINE Thanks You…Forever”

A one night stay in a local Blacksburg, Virginia, a guided tour of the school, a local, organic dinner with the MINE Director, MINE Director of Nutrition, MINE Chef and MINE teachers, a MINE-inspired 5 item gift box, and a box of fresh fruit and veggie goodies from one of MINE’s local farmer partners.

$4000 – “Adopt a classroom” + complimentary “MINE Thanks You…Forever”

Get a year’s worth of monthly updates about how your support specifically helped the classroom, complete with pictures, notes from the teachers and the Director, stories from the children. Choose the Nido Environment and support infant development; children ages 8 weeks to 18 months. Choose the Toddler Community to support toddler independence; children ages 18 – 36 months. Choose the Children’s House to support concrete-to-abstract academics; children ages 3-6 years.

$4500 - “Adopt Chef Glisyn’s Kitchen” + complimentary “MINE Thanks You…Forever”

Get a year’s worth of monthly updates about how your support specifically helped set up the MINE kitchen and provide the children’s meals and snacks, seed-to-table experiences, and cooking classes for MINE children and their “Special Adult,” complete with pictures, notes from Chef Glisyn, the MINE Director of Nutrition and the MINE director, and, of course, stories from the children.

$5000 – “Make a MINE Change” + complimentary “MINE Thanks You…Forever” 

A scholarship fund set up in your name to help build and implement your choice of:

MINE’s Nutrition and Food Program –“The Food and Nutrition Program at MINE emphasizes a seed-to-table experience which respects children’s capacity for curiosity, exploration, comprehension, and initiative, as well as honors the innate investment they have in their own experiences in their lives. Food is an important part of life, not only for life-sustaining purposes, but also for the treasures that nurturing life, creating beauty and providing delicious meals for friends gives. In the age of packaged and processed foods, our children are denied these treasures. At MINE we celebrate food and all of its marvels.”

MINE’s Creating Green Habits Initiatives – “The children and teachers at MINE work together to create a deep respect for and honor of nature and our relationship with it. Being “Green” is a HABIT. The experience at MINE for children, teachers, families and visitors is to participate in the habit being environmentally responsible. These habits are reinforced with an all organic and vegetarian menu, organic ointments, organic cloth diapers and linens throughout the school, and the use of real forks, knives, spoons, and cups, supporting local farms from CSAs and farmers market, and ordering all supplies from companies with green initiatives.”

MINE’s Integrated Peace-Building Initiatives – “It is important for the development of children’s self-esteem to know their place in a community, to understand what they offer their community, and to engage in responsibility to others. Children’s work at MINE includes peace initiatives, meditation, conflict resolution, multicultural respect, and human rights as ways to build and integrate peace within their lives, classroom, and broader communities.”

MINE’s Parent Support Program – Parenting is really wonderful and parenting is really difficult.  It’s easy to love your child, easy to find sheer joy in their company, easy to have your heart ache when they aren’t around. It’s difficult to navigate the massive amount of scientific research, professional and anecdotal advice, differing and competitive theories, and unending tidbits of information about how to parent successfully. Add to that the financial, emotional, social, and familial pressures surrounding raising young children and a parent can be left feeling unsupported, overwhelmed, and lost. Parents need support. Parents need help. Parents need advocates.  MINE is a resource to help parents in their journey of parenting. MINE offers classes, groups, individual meetings, and links to community resources for parents and families.

MINE’s Teacher Support Program – Early childhood educators are notoriously underpaid, overworked and drastically under-valued in this country. The prevailing tendency is to consider the first three years of life as developmentally less important to invest in socially and financially as other ages and stages of childhood. However, the first three years are when we as humans learn to move our bodies with intention and communicate effectively with others; we learn the rules of our world. MINE promotes the worth of the first three years and of the teachers who spend their days and careers supporting the development of the young child and the health of their families.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can financially contribute to our campaign. Please help get the word out about Montessori Infant Nido Environment. Use the Indiegogo share tools, announce it on your social media, tell your friends, tell everyone you know!!

You can make a difference in our campaign and in the lives of young children, parents, families, teachers, farmers, etc.
story_txt:
Montessori Infant Nido Environment (MINE) is a year round, Organic, Montessori School. The MINE mission is to provide a nurturing, home-like educational environment for the very young wherein they are encouraged and supported to do the important lifework of becoming a fully developed, whole person who is aware of individual, environmental, and community responsibilities.  Over many years of raising my own children, teaching in Montessori schools, and studying Montessori philosophy and child development, I formed a vision of a school that integrated the fundamental aspects of Maria Montessori’s vision for child education with the foundational qualities of human kindness, environmental stewardship, mutual trust, and community engagement to create a school that embodied all that I wished was available when my children were young.    I opened the doors to MINE, in August 2013, serving 5 children in my home...  ...but then something amazing happened. As I shared my vision of MINE with others, they started volunteering their time, creativity, services, and resources. They gave of these things freely because they, like me, believed in the potential of raising the standards and value of childcare and education for the very young and the MINE vision grew into what it is now: a year-round, all-natural, organic Montessori school for children ages 8 weeks through 6 years.    The current plan for MINE includes organic and vegetarian meals and snacks, organic cloth diapers for the younger children, organic linens for every child, and all-natural materials in every classroom. Eventually MINE will become a 501c3 Not-For-Profit school. MINE has Isla the school dog and Bleu the school cat with whom the children learn to develop positive relationships with animals. An organic seed-to-table experience, environmental responsibility, and peace-building are woven into the daily curriculum.   Most importantly, the school is being created to serve as a community resource for children, parents and families. Partnering with local farmers, furniture makers, child specialists, midwives and pediatricians, and various organizations that serve children, MINE and its teachers will be a supreme advocate for children and parents while supporting the local community. Additionally, once off the ground, the MINE Food Program will be refined to create a template and act as a resource to help implement and support an organic, seed-to-table culinary curriculum in group childcare programs across the nation.The goal of the co-creators and supporters of MINE is to change to
culture of how we think about, what we expect, and how we regard educational
experiences for children from birth to three years.
This campaign is to financially support the collection of
talented teachers, passionate and committed parents, and interested community
members that have joined together to push Montessori Infant Nido Environment to
the next level. This campaign will change the lives of local children, parents and families, and will help create a change-agent for the greater culture to re-value the first three years of children's lives, their parent's experiences, the worth of their caregivers, and the significance of their daycare/preschool experience.What we need
The $25,000 is needed to expand the school to serve not 5, but
50 young children while maintaining the vision and goals of the school.
• 
A portion of the funds will help us secure the building needed
to expand. 
• 
A portion will be used to purchase Montessori materials for the
classrooms and furnish each classroom with child-sized chairs, tables and other
classroom furniture from local businesses that support local carpenters. 
• 
A portion of the funds will be used to purchase lumber needed to
build a wooden climbing structure, an extension of the roof to provide an
outdoor classroom so the children can work and play outside in inclement
weather, as well as sand for the playground. 
• 
A portion of the funds will help set up partnerships and
relationships with local farmers to source food and create farming mentorship
programs for the children and the school. This portion will include purchasing
local fruit trees, berry bushes, vegetables, herbs and bee-attracting flowers
for the MINE garden. 
• 
A portion of the funds will go towards the documentation and
codification of the process of setting up an all-natural, organic school for
the purpose of creating a template for other daycares and preschools. 
If we don’t reach our campaign goal of $25,000, the money
donated will still go towards the expansion of the school and programs and
initiatives in the order listed above. 

What you get!(The exciting perks are described here in detail. To choose them, use the perk links on the right-hand side of your screen)

community.

shout out of thanks on the MINE Facebook page!

incentive gift, of course we will honor that.

story:
The Jewish Museum and Archives of BC badly needs a new website that will allow us to bring you world class online exhibits profiling the amazing stories of our community, and make our archival collection available to researchers and students everywhere.

Members of our community have achieved some impressive accomplishments over the past 150 years, working with the many other communities of BC to make our province truly great. Here at the JMABC, it is our responsibility to ensure that these stories are remembered for generations.


Museums around the world are doing amazing things to bring their collections to life through innovative online exhibits. We want to bring you the same quality of exhibits filled with vitality.

The new Jewish Museum website will be your source for all information about the history of Jewish life in BC. If you want to learn about how your family came to BC, this site will be the place to look. If you want to arrange a walking tour of old Jewish Vancouver for visiting out-of-town friends and family, this site will have all the information necessary. If you want to research the growth of Oakridge or the history of your synagogue, our online exhibits will have everything you need to get started.

We’re working hard to make sure this site fills the needs of our community and is easy to use.

It’s a big project and we’re going to need your help to make it happen. We need to raise $18,000 through Indiegogo to supplement the grants and donations we’ve started to receive. We want to do it right – we want to build a strong website that will last for years to come.


We’ve got some great perks lined up to express our thanks for your support. These include:

·  Historic walking tours

·  Personalized archives tours

·  Complementary memberships

·  High-quality prints of some of the best photos in our collection

·  And much more!

** Tax Receipts will be issued for contributions of $36 or more. **


The new Jewish Museum website is an important part of our efforts to make our collection available as widely as possible and engage a new generation in our community’s history.

Teachers and students will benefit from better, more engaging and informative online exhibits made possible by the new capabilities of this website.

The Jewish and non-Jewish communities of BC will benefit from this project by sharing history with each other, fostering a better understanding of each other’s experiences and cultural identities.

Staff and volunteer time required to upload new archival content to the website will be dramatically reduced, allowing us to accomplish these nitty-gritty tasks far more efficiently and instead be able to focus our energies on developing innovative, informative and engaging online and physical exhibits and public learning opportunities.


Since 1970, the Jewish Museum and Archives of British Columbia has been the preeminent and authoritative body for the collection, preservation and sharing of Jewish life in BC. Through innovative exhibits and public programming, the JMABC builds bridges with the diverse communities of BC and heightens awareness of the rich history of Jews in BC.


    • Help us spread the word about this campaign!
    • Share our video with your friends!
    • If you or someone you know is interested in making a larger donation, please contact us!

story:
A Little About Me

  • My name is Christian Call. I am a Mechanic, Designer, Builder and Amputee. I am just a regular person that has come into some irregular circumstances and is doing what I think I need to do to help others that may be in similar circumstances. I hope that everyone will see the need for this as I do. 
  • This campaign is to accomplish my dream of helping other amputees to get a level of usefulness back from their hands and regain any dignity and self esteem that may be lost because of their situation.
  • With the goal I have set, I will be able to get quality machines and supplies that are able to reproduce my design at the detail and quality that is required for the level of complexity in my designs. There is nothing out there available for finger tip amputees that is truly affordable and functions as well as my designs do and is 3D printable. We are trying to raise money for new high end 3D printers and scanners to allow us to create higher detail and higher quality 3D printed prosthetics. With new printers we will be able to make other prosthetics as well. Please give to my Indiegogo campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am asking for 10,000.00 to purchase two new high quality 3D printers (Airwolf 3D HD at 3,000.00 ea.) or two Ultimaker 2 machines (2,600.00 ea.) to maintain the large build volume, a 3D scanner (1000.00) to assist in the modeling process which will dramatically shorten the design and build time, quality software (3,000.00) for modeling, and consumables ( 500+or-) such as quality filament and tools for the build process. 
  • For rewards for donations, I can offer is 3D printed products such as a hand crank cell phone charger, gravity or hand crank dynamo light, and custom themed e-cig vaporizer battery mods. All of which are designed, 3D printed, and built my me.
  • All money goes toward my goal of producing low cost prosthetics.

The Impact

I struggled for a year after my accident to find an affordable alternative to the products offered to amputees such as myself. I simply could not afford them especially since my employer decided to let me go after the accident and I found myself with no insurance and very little money. Finally I resigned to the fact that if I didn't make it myself then I wasn't going to get a prosthetic and I would have to get used to the limitation caused by my missing index finger tip. Only someone that has used their hands their entire life knows how limiting a missing index finger tip really is. 3D printing has opened up an entirely new world of creativity for me. Not only have I built myself a usable prosthetic, I have dedicated myself to making them available to others in need.

  • Through your donations you can have the satisfaction of knowing that the money is really going to help people in a way that most folks might never think of.
  • I have designed and built prosthetics for others and myself. All of which work and are  easy to wear and use. I have worked with others on their own designs and will continue to do so as long as there is a need for my work.
  • This stuff as simple as it seems to some people can make a huge difference for folks who are less fortunate and cant afford what is available out there. There are those I have talked to that would have never considered an expensive prosthetic and with my help are now getting excited about the prospect of regaining functionality of a missing digit.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't give a donation you can still help by spreading the word by sharing this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and others.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools if you can!

With new printers we will be able to make other prosthetics as well. Please give to my Indiegogo campaign.
What We Need & What You Get
I am asking for 10,000.00 to purchase two new high quality 3D printers (Airwolf 3D HD at 3,000.00 ea.) or two Ultimaker 2 machines (2,600.00 ea.) to maintain the large build volume, a 3D scanner (1000.00) to assist in the modeling process which will dramatically shorten the design and build time, quality software (3,000.00) for modeling, and consumables ( 500+or-) such as quality filament and tools for the build process. 
For rewards for donations, I can offer is 3D printed products such as a hand crank cell phone charger, gravity or hand crank dynamo light, and custom themed e-cig vaporizer battery mods. All of which are designed, 3D printed, and built my me.
All money goes toward my goal of producing low cost prosthetics.
The ImpactI struggled for a year after my accident to find an affordable alternative to the products offered to amputees such as myself. I simply could not afford them especially since my employer decided to let me go after the accident and I found myself with no insurance and very little money. Finally I resigned to the fact that if I didn't make it myself then I wasn't going to get a prosthetic and I would have to get used to the limitation caused by my missing index finger tip. Only someone that has used their hands their entire life knows how limiting a missing index finger tip really is. 3D printing has opened up an entirely new world of creativity for me. Not only have I built myself a usable prosthetic, I have dedicated myself to making them available to others in need.
Through your donations you can have the satisfaction of knowing that the money is really going to help people in a way that most folks might never think of.
I have designed and built prosthetics for others and myself. All of which work and are  easy to wear and use. I have worked with others on their own designs and will continue to do so as long as there is a need for my work.
This stuff as simple as it seems to some people can make a huge difference for folks who are less fortunate and cant afford what is available out there. There are those I have talked to that would have never considered an expensive prosthetic and with my help are now getting excited about the prospect of regaining functionality of a missing digit.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't give a donation you can still help by spreading the word by sharing this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and others.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools if you can!

story:
UPDATE!!!!!!

Thanks to a modest amount of discovered aid, and the generosity of donors (here and private donors), I am so very close to my goal. I no longer need $5000, but only $1000!!!!! This is great news, excellent news! But it will happen. Thank you to everyone! Now, my last semester of college is set, but there are still issues with the Rome trip (which provides college credits needed to graduate ~ and a life changing experience)


Hi!  My name is Dawne Kennedy and I am a senior undergraduate at the University of Southern Mississippi. I'm not your average student, though. I came back to school after having been in an auto accident that left me disabled. Determination, faith, and an excellent support system of family and friends have seen improvements in my mobility. While I'll never be "normal" in the physical range, I am determined to get my education and be a productive member of society, an awesome professor upon receiving my degree, and a great mom, daughter, sister, and friend. 

While at USM, I have worked extremely hard. In the past 3½ years, I've received numerous academic honors, and am set to graduate with Latin Designation at the top of my class. Here's where the problem comes in: I received an email from the Financial Aid department earlier this semester. They alerted me to the fact that I was out of federal aid (Pell Grants and Stafford Loans), and only had a small amount left with which to pay for my senior year.  That scared me so badly. I've worked so hard, and come too far not to be able to finish my degree. Because I have an awesome family, they were able to help out with loans, but none of us are wealthy, or able to write checks that would cover this… so, a friend suggested that I try this approach.

On top of the financial aid ruckus, I was set to use some of that aid in conjunction with a scholarship I had won to study abroad this summer because the scholarship didn’t cover the entire tuition, the plane ticket, or living expenses while in Rome. (Yes, Rome! Me! I've never been anywhere and this would be an absolute dream come true!) But most importantly, I still have a year left until I graduate.  I have come too far to give up now. I hate asking for help, but I am swallowing my pride and humbly asking… Will you please help me?


PS: That picture is of me presenting an overview of my Honors research (up to this date) in a statewide conference just a couple of weeks ago. I can't wait to teach someday!

story:
Blurb!

My name is Jon Viktor Corpuz. I was one of 66 admitted students out of 859 total (top 7.7%) who was admitted to A Cappella Academy (http://acappellacademy.org/) for their inaugural session this summer!

A Cappella Academy is a brand new summer program in Los Angeles designed to train and educate the bright young minds of contemporary a cappella music! 

Sing-Off champions and global a cappella phenomenon PENTATONIX will join as artists in residence for 2014, where they’ll teach classes, workshops, offer advice, and headline the two back-to-back camp showcases on July 12.

A Cappella Academy's goal is to provide motivated, talented young artists with a unique creative environment where we can develop our skills as vocalists, beatboxers, arrangers, music directors, songwriters, and producers. The camp is bringing together some of the most forward-thinking minds in the field of a cappella to help us campers discover new skills, and to hone the skills we already have. All the while, we’ll be creating close friendships working alongside our incredibly talented peers from all across the country.

To help make this dream come true, to work with some of the most amazing musicians in the world, including Pentatonix, Ben Bram, and many more, I need YOUR help.

What I Need, a.k.a. How YOU can help make this dream a reality!

  • $730 FOR TUITION: I was able to raise $1,065 through various donors and a scholarship from the camp, but I still need $730 to meet the full tuition cost!
  • $595 IN AIR FARE: Plane tickets today are not cheap, as we all know! The average air fare from NYC to LA is about $600. Even if I raise enough tuition money, without your help, I won't be able to physically get to the camp. ;)

Without your help, I may not be able to make it to camp, so please help me make this dream a reality.

The Impact

This camp experience will be invaluable to me. The musicians I will get to work with, the friendships and connections I'll be able to build, and the environment I will be able to create and grow in will forever be irreplaceable and invaluable assets that will follow me for the rest of my life. YOU have the opportunity to change my life, to help me learn and create and grow tremendously as a musician and artist. Please do whatever is in your heart to help make this incredible learning and growing experience a reality. I will be forever grateful! Seriously. :)

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you absolutely cannot make a donation, help me spread the word! Helping me get the word out to others through social media: Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Tumblr, Instagram, Keek, Vine, etc. will help me garner donations to ultimately help me reach my goal.

story:
The Rogers Road neighborhood is a socially cohesive and ethnically diverse community in Chapel Hill, North Carolina. This community has experienced significant environmental discrimination since the Orange County Landfill was built adjacent to the neighborhood in 1979. For nearly four decades, the neighborhood has been fighting to mediate the environmental and health effects of the landfill. Dedicated community members formed the Rogers-Eubanks Neighborhood Association (RENA), which since 2007 has raised awareness about the environment and improved basic academic and education opportunities.


In 2014, Orange County local government funded the construction of the Rogers Road Community Center. RENA runs dozens of programs from the community center, including summer camps and after school education programs for children in the area. 


Solarize Orange County is working to install a solar array to provide clean energy to the Rogers Road Community Center. Having the solar panels on the building also creates an opportunity to educate students about environmental issues and how to solve them.


To take advantage of this opportunity, RENA and Solarize Orange County are partnering together to develop a week-long, environmentally focused, summer camp at the Rogers Road Community Center. In this program, students will explore all the ways the sun can power our lives. Students will build a solar powered irrigation system to improve existing community gardens, create solar gadgets, and design solar ovens. With the necessary materials, our goal is to inspire the students with hands-on experience while learning about clean energy sources.


Help us reach our goal of covering the material cost for 15 students to participate in the summer camp by funding our campaign!

 

To learn more about the Rogers Road Community click here.

story:
Check out this 30 second video, to learn more...


Donation Details: Meredith will donate a portion of the proceeds to support women and girls around the world. Beginning June 29, 2015 at 12:00 am ET and ending on July 29, 2015 at 11:59 pm ET, Meredith Corporation, on behalf of MORE magazine will donate 80% from the first $1 million raised through the Program to The Peace Corps’ Let Girls Learn Program (maximum donation: $800,000) to expand access to education for girls around the world. Meredith will donate 10% of the money raised, over $1 million, to CARE, whose mission is to serve individuals and families in the poorest communities in the world (minimum donation $1000). For full terms and conditions visit more.com/emterms.  


  • Shop early and often—we will be adding new experiences every day.
  • The more we sell, the more of a difference we can make for women and girls around the world.
  • Help us spread the word! Please share these opportunities with your friends and family who might be interested. In fact, think about getting a group together to all chip in toward the bigger experiences for multiple people. 

About MORE: Critically acclaimed MORE is the only lifestyle publication that celebrates women of style and substance. MORE is the smart, stylish guide for women of influence, sharing the latest on beauty, fashion, health, career, finance, home, travel and culture.    

The July/August 2015 issue of MORE magazine was guest-edited by First Lady Michelle Obama. You can read about women who are making "MORE Impact" in the world by supporting our vets, getting our children to move more, and promoting education for young people in America as well as for adolescent girls around the world. Her experiences and her wisdom inspire us.

About Let Girls Learn:  Educating girls is essential to healthy and thriving communities but, globally, more than 62 million girls are not in school, and barriers to adolescent girls completing school are particularly significant. When a girl receives an education, she is more likely to earn a viable living, raise a healthier family, and improve the quality of life for herself, her family, and her community. That’s why President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama are championing Let Girls Learn, a powerful government-wide collaboration to expand access to education for girls around the world.

About Peace Corps: The Peace Corps sends the best and brightest Americans abroad on behalf of the United States to tackle the most pressing needs of people around the world.  Today nearly 7,000 Volunteers, work in more than 60 countries across the globe. The Peace Corps' Let Girls Learn program will address barriers to girls' education by empowering local leaders in communities around the globe to put in place lasting solutions. Peace Corps Volunteers, who live and work at the grassroots level, will serve as catalysts of community-led change, but they need the support of Americans from all walks of life to get involved and make a difference. Money going to the Let Girls Learn Fund directly supports Volunteer projects and community training around the globe. Your contribution will reach those in need and make a positive impact. You can learn more at LetGirlsLearn.PeaceCorps.gov.

General Disclaimer: Use of the Peace Corps name or logo does not constitute or imply an official or personal endorsement by the Peace Corps, the United States, or its officers or employees of Meredith, MORE or any related product, person, or service.

About CARE: CARE is a leading humanitarian organization fighting global poverty. They place special focus on working alongside poor women because, equipped with the proper resources, women have the power to help whole families and entire communities escape poverty. CARE's mission is to serve individuals and families in the poorest communities in the world. Women are at the heart of CARE's community-based efforts to improve basic education, end gender-based violence, provide healthcare and nutrition, increase access to clean water and sanitation, expand economic opportunity and protect natural resources. CARE also delivers emergency aid to survivors of war and natural disasters, and helps people rebuild their lives.

About Meredith Corporation: Meredith Corporation is a media and marketing company that produces many of the brands that women around the world love and trust, such as MORE, Better Homes and Gardens, Parents, Family Circle, Family Fun, All Recipes, Eating Well, Every Day with Rachael Ray, Shape, Martha Stewart Living, Traditional Home, Siempre Mujer, American Baby, MyWedding, Ser Padres and Midwest Living.


ABBREVIATED TERMS & CONDITIONS:
Begins 12:00 p.m. ET 6/29/15 and ends 11:59 p.m. ET 7/29/15. MORE is conducting a crowdfunding campaign where you can purchase unique experiences. MORE will donate 80% of the first $1 million raised to Let Girls Learn, thereafter, MORE will donate 10% of the money raised to CARE. Open to legal residents of the 50 U.S. & D.C. 21+. Void where prohibited. For complete Terms and Conditions, visit more.com/emterms. Offered by Meredith Corporation.

WHAT DO I DO IF I NEED HELP?
If you have questions or need help, send an email with your phone number to ExperienceMore@meredith.com and a representative will contact you within 24 hours. (Please note: experience/perk availability not guaranteed)

I SAW AN EXPERIENCE ADVERTISED ONLINE/ON TV THAT IS NOT ON THE LIST OF AVAILABLE EXPERIENCES ON THE SITE:
We have hundreds of different experiences/perks to sell, but we can only display 20 at a time. If you don't see an experience you like or are specifically looking for, please be sure to check back each day to shop our ever-changing store. Click here to see the complete list of experiences that will go on sale during the campaign, and sign up to receive a daily email describing the experiences that will be on sale that day. You can also send a help request to our customer service line at ExperienceMore@meredith.com.

HOW DOES THIS WORK? AM I BIDDING FOR THESE EXPERIENCES?
No, you are not bidding. You will be buying the experiences, just like from an online store. 

WHEN WILL MY CREDIT CARD BE CHARGED?
Your card will be charged at the time of transaction. 

WHEN WILL MY EXPERIENCE BE FULFILLED?
Fulfillment timing depends on the experience/perk you purchase. Some experiences have pre-set dates that are listed in the experience description. These dates cannot be changed. For open-ended experiences, where an appointment or specific date needs to be scheduled, a representative will reach out to you to schedule a date that is mutually agreeable to all parties. For items to be shipped, the ship-by date is listed in the experience details. While most items will be fulfilled more quickly, MORE/Meredith has one year from the end of the campaign (until July 29, 2016) to fulfill all experiences and items.

WHAT IF WE ARE UNABLE TO FIND A MUTUALLY AGREEABLE FULFILLMENT DATE WITHIN THE NEXT YEAR?

All best efforts will be made to schedule a mutually agreeable time for your experience. If it is impossible to schedule an experience at a mutually agreeable time within one year from the end of the campaign (by July 29, 2016), Sponsor reserves the right to substitute an experience (or a portion thereof) of equal or greater value if the experience purchased (or portion thereof) cannot be awarded as described.  Experiences may not be assigned, transferred, changed or redeemed for cash, except at the sole discretion of Sponsor.

DOES MY PURCHASE BENEFIT CHARITY?

Yes! Meredith Corporation, on behalf of MORE magazine, will donate 80% from the first $1 million raised through the Program to The Peace Corps’ Let Girls Learn Fund (up to maximum donation: $800,000),. and thereafter, Meredith will donate 10% of the money raised over $1 million to CARE (minimum donation: $1000). For more information about The Peace Corps’ Let Girls Learn Fund, visit letgirlslearn.peacecorps.gov. For more information about CARE, visit care.org.

DO I HAVE TO PAY SALES TAX?
Not all purchases require sales tax. If sales tax is required, it has been built into the fee.

DO I HAVE TO PAY SHIPPING?                                                                                   For most perks,  the shipping and handling of experiences or perks is covered in the total price. If there is an additional shipping fee, it is reflected in the perk description.

ARE THERE REFUNDS? 

We hope you won’t request a refund as the proceeds from your purchases will be helping women and girls around the world. In the rare instance for some unforeseen circumstances, as determined in Sponsor’s sole discretion, the experience becomes unavailable in accordance with the terms and conditions for this Program, you may request a refund minus a 15% administration fee.  Note that Sponsor reserves the right to substitute an experience (or a portion thereof) of equal or greater value if the experience purchased (or portion thereof) cannot be awarded as described.  Experiences may not be assigned, transferred, changed or redeemed for cash, except at the sole discretion of Sponsor.

CAN AN EXPERIENCE BE TRANSFERRED OR RESOLD IF I CAN'T DO IT?          You may give the experience to someone else if  you wish, however, you may not re-sell it.

IS THERE PAPERWORK I HAVE TO SIGN? Depending on the experience purchased, you may need to sign paperwork before you can participate. If you have questions about paperwork that would be required for a specific experience, please send an email to the customer service line at ExperienceMore@meredith.com and we will get back to you with an answer within 48 hours.

HOW DO I BUY AN EXPERIENCE/PERK? Simply click on the perk you want to buy and follow the instructions in the Indiegogo payment site for entering your credit care or PayPal information.

ONCE AN EXPERIENCE/PERK IS SOLD, IS THAT EXPERIENCE/PERK GONE FOR GOOD? If there is only one of a particular perk for sale, when it is sold, it is no longer available. If we discover a strong interest in a particular perk, we may go back to the provider to see if he/she will be willing to offer additional experiences for sale. If something has sold out and you were particularly interested in buying it, please send an email to the customer service line at ExperienceMore@meredith.com and we will get back to you with an answer within 48 hours.

WHEN WILL YOU CHOOSE THE CONTEST WINNERS? On or about August 21, 2015, the winners of the two contests will be chosen and notified. For more specifics about the rules for these contests, please see more.com/emrules.

All best efforts will be made to schedule a mutually agreeable time for your experience. If it is impossible to schedule an experience at a mutually agreeable time within one year from the end of the campaign (by July 29, 2016), Sponsor reserves the right to substitute an experience (or a portion thereof) of equal or greater value if the experience purchased (or portion thereof) cannot be awarded as described.  Experiences may not be assigned, transferred, changed or redeemed for cash, except at the sole discretion of Sponsor.
DOES MY PURCHASE BENEFIT CHARITY?

Yes! Meredith Corporation, on behalf of MORE magazine, will donate 80% from the first $1 million raised through the Program to The Peace Corps’ Let Girls Learn Fund (up to maximum donation: $800,000),. and thereafter, Meredith will donate 10% of the money raised over $1 million to CARE (minimum donation: $1000). For more information about The Peace Corps’ Let Girls Learn Fund, visit letgirlslearn.peacecorps.gov. For more information about CARE, visit care.org.
DO I HAVE TO PAY SALES TAX?Not all purchases require sales tax. If sales tax is required, it has been built into the fee.
DO I HAVE TO PAY SHIPPING?                                                                                   For most perks,  the shipping and handling of experiences or perks is covered in the total price. If there is an additional shipping fee, it is reflected in the perk description.


ARE THERE REFUNDS? 

We hope you won’t request a refund as the proceeds from your purchases will be helping women and girls around the world. In the rare instance for some unforeseen circumstances, as determined in Sponsor’s sole discretion, the experience becomes unavailable in accordance with the terms and conditions for this Program, you may request a refund minus a 15% administration fee.  Note that Sponsor reserves the right to substitute an experience (or a portion thereof) of equal or greater value if the experience purchased (or portion thereof) cannot be awarded as described.  Experiences may not be assigned, transferred, changed or redeemed for cash, except at the sole discretion of Sponsor.

CAN AN EXPERIENCE BE TRANSFERRED OR RESOLD IF I
CAN'T DO IT?          You may give the experience to someone else if  you wish, however, you may not re-sell it.
IS THERE PAPERWORK I HAVE TO SIGN? Depending on
the experience purchased, you may need to sign paperwork before you can
participate. If you have questions about paperwork that would be required for a
specific experience, please send an email to the customer service line at ExperienceMore@meredith.com and
we will get back to you with an answer within 48 hours.
HOW DO I BUY AN EXPERIENCE/PERK? Simply click on
the perk you want to buy and follow the instructions in the Indiegogo payment
site for entering your credit care or PayPal information. 
ONCE AN EXPERIENCE/PERK IS SOLD, IS THAT
EXPERIENCE/PERK GONE FOR GOOD? If there is only one of a particular perk for
sale, when it is sold, it is no longer available. If we discover a strong
interest in a particular perk, we may go back to the provider to see if he/she
will be willing to offer additional experiences for sale. If something has sold
out and you were particularly interested in buying it, please send an email to
the customer service line at ExperienceMore@meredith.com
and we will get back to you with an answer within 48 hours.
WHEN WILL YOU CHOOSE THE CONTEST WINNERS? On or
about August 21, 2015, the winners of the two contests will be chosen and
notified. For more specifics about the rules for these contests, please see
more.com/emrules.

story:
Tanja is a 20 year old Student, studying in the UK in hope of a bright future. Having emigrated from war torn Bosnia to the United States at a young age, her and her father wished for a promising new life. Her father wishes only the best for his daughter, and she is currently studying towards her second year of a degree at the University of Winchester in the UK. Here she has made many friends and she hopes to study for a Masters degree whilst leading the  University's Basketball team to victory!

But, this could all be lost. Tanja's loans have been declined through her father in the United States. Her father has been having to fund medical bills for Tanja and her brother and now FAFSA have declined her loans.

Tanja has been a hardworking student, is a fun and lively person and her friends are desperate for her to stay!!! If we can raise enough for one years education and rent this would be AMAZING. Please help!

story:
Ein bwriad / Our aim

Ein bwriad yw i gyflogi trefnydd yn ystod yr haf er mwyn cydlynu ein presenoldeb mewn ffeiriau'r glas mewn Prifysgolion a Cholegau Addysg Bellach ar draws Cymru. Yn ogystal, hoffem greu pecynnau aelodaeth newydd i bob aelod ifanc o'r Blaid, fel y bont yn ymwybodol o'n gweithgareddau a'n neges. Yn olaf, hoffem allu creu nwyddau o safon uchel, fel crysau-T, sticeri, bathodynau a phosteri er mwyn cyrraedd rhagor o bobl. 

Our aim is to employ an organiser during the summer months to coordinate our presence in Freshers' Fairs in Universities and FE Colleges across Wales. We'd also like to create membership packs for all young Plaid members, so that they are all aware of our activities and our message. Last but not least, we'd like to create some high quality merchandise, such as T-shirts, stickers, badges and posters to reach more young people. 

Yr hyn sydd angen arnom / What We Need

Byddai cyflogi trefnydd ar gyflog byw ym mis Awst yn unig yn costio tua £1500, heb sôn am gost nwyddau newydd na'r adnoddau fyddai angen ar ein trefnydd i greu pecynnau . Rydym yn fudiad cymharol fach, sy'n dibynnu gan fwyaf ar garedigrwydd aelodau "llai ifanc" o Blaid Cymru i'n hariannu!

An organiser earning a living wage in August alone would cost about £1500 to fund, let alone the cost of new merchandise as well as the resources our organiser will need to create the membership packs.  We're quite a small movement, and we depend on the "less young" members of Plaid Cymru for a large amount of our funding! 

Eich effaith / Your Impact

Rydym yn ceisio adeiladu mudiad ieuenctid sy'n ceisio gwneud y frwydr dros ryddid yn berthnasol a deniadol i bobl ifanc Cymru heddiw. Byddai eich rhodd, gyn lleied ag y bo, yn ein cynorthwyo i gryfhau elfen hanfodol o'r mudiad cenedlaethol. Diolch yn fawr am eich cefnogaeth!

We're trying to build a youth movement that makes the fight for national liberation relevant and attractive to young people today. Your donation, as small as it may be, would help us to strengthen a crucial element of the national movement. Thanks for your support!

story:
This is a programme for Young Women to connect with their Medicine. For a month together at Kufunda Learning Village we return to the grace, the power and the pride in what it means to be a woman today. 

Our core assumption is that women are not a 'problem to be solved', but a gift to be embraced, and so we navigate the territory of the many challenges facing young women today from a place of discovering and recovering the innate strength and capacity that resides in each one - to be able to return more equipped to face those challenges from a place of calm confidence. 

Young women in Zimbabwe face many challenges - many of them stemming from being seen as the weaker sex.  To be a successful women, often means to get married and have children. While we don't negate these important life stages, they place the emphasis away from the woman in her own right. This programme is a time for these women to come back to their own centre and find their strength and confidence therein.

"A new spark arose in me during this programme. To be a woman in Zimbabwe means that our knowledge and experience about ourselves – what we are, what we know – is limited. We grow up in structures with already set roles. Men have greater possibilities to discover what they want in life. We have to relate to men’s opinions about us and live up to society’s expectations of us as women. This programme starts the other way around…With us."

 Sikhethiwe Mlotsha

Core principles informing our programme are:

  • Gift: Allowing each woman to bring her gift to the collective
  • Ritual: Creating a sacred journey together
  • Emergence: Working with the wisdom of what is emerging in each moment
  • Dance: As a way of opening our self-expression
  • Exploration: Quiet inward exploration and active outward exploration.


For just 4600 USD we can run a month long programme for 20 beautiful young women of Zimbabwe and the region. 


In their words.....

"During the years of crisis in 2007-2008, many women who belonged to the opposition party were sexually abused and raped. My work as a facilitator in Tree of Life is to listen to these people, to clarify their testimonies and stories. But in the programme Young Women are Medicine – it is all about me! About what steps I should take in my life.I learn so much. Even in my own marriage, I now feel able to express myself better and I am able to be more open. I will dare to stand up more for myself."

Nyengeterai, participant of YWAM 2015

A lot of things have happened. When the girls first arrived many of them were shy and not daring to be open to us in the village. But now! It is like their courage shines through them, there is a visible power, even when they talk to the men in the village. After this programme I am relieved. I am full of courage. I am open to hear more stories and to share my own. There must be more programmes like this. Definately.

   Tsitsi Mayakaza, Kufunda Village

story:
***Scroll down for English version.***

Znanstveni piknik dobiva krov nad glavom!

Znanstveni piknik, najveći događaj popularizacije znanosti u Hrvatskoj i regiji, dobiva krov nad glavom - za tri mjeseca smjestit će se u Centar za popularizaciju znanosti, mjesto gdje će djeca i mladi imati priliku istraživati znanost kroz zabavu svakog dana u godini.

Novi znanstveni edukativno-zabavni centar sadržavat će ono najbolje od Znanstvenog piknika:

EDUKACIJE HRVATSKIH ZNANSTVENIKA

EKSPERIMENTE

ZNANSTVENE INSTRUMENTE I EKSPONATE

Nedostajat će samo jedno - veliko Newtonovo njihalo.

NJIHALO

Veliko Newtonovo njihalo jedno je od najprimamljivijih eksponenata za igru od prvog dana Znanstvenog piknika. Uglavnom poznato kao stolna igračka, Newtonovo njihalo doseglo je novu razinu zabavnog kada se na Znanstvenom pikniku pojavilo u većem obliku od uobičajenog - svi su ga htjeli isprobati, što je dovelo do pitanja "Čemu služi?" i učenja o osnovnim zakonima fizike.

Štoviše, nakon godine intenzivnog škljocanja loptica na Znanstvenom pikniku, njihalo se poprilično oštetilo te će posljednji puta biti korišteno na događaju u rujnu. Također, zbog nepristupačne cijene, njihalo koje smo do sada koristili na Pikniku redovito smo posuđivali. Sada kada se pripremamo za otvaranje znanstvenog edukativno-zabavnog centra, ovo znači upravo ono o čemu razmišljate - trebamo novo, naše njihalo!

Novo njihalo bit će još bolje od onoga koje smo koristili posljednjih godina. Osim što će biti veličine prostorije, čineći ga nemogućim za ne primijetiti i poželjeti istraživati, njegove kugle moći će se ispunjavati različitim materijalima, poput pijeska i vode. Njihalo će također biti sigurnosno prilagođeno za izložbe i demonstracije.

Što možemo naučiti uz Newtonovo njihalo?

Iako kreirano kao uredska igračka za relaksiranje, njihalo je nazvano prema znanstveniku i matematičaru Isaacu Newtonu. Uređaj demonstrira neke od osnovnih zakona fizike na jednostavan i zabavan način, što ga čini idealnom igračkom za interaktivno učenje o:

OČUVANJE ENERGIJE -> Podizanjem i puštanjem kugle na jednom kraju njihala kugla na suprotnom kraju će se, zahvaljujući očuvanju i izmjeni energije, pokrenuti na identičan način, potičući njihovo uzastopno kretanje.

OČUVANJE GIBANJA -> Nakon što podignemo i pustimo prvu kuglu, ona se neće samo odbiti od druge u nizu, već će se očuvanjem smjera gibanja kretati u jednom smjeru sve do posljednje lopte u nizu.

TRENJE -> Slijed uzastopnog kretanja kugli zaustavit će se zbog trenja u njihovoj unutrašnjosti, koje će pretvaranjem dovoljne količne energije dovesti do zaustavljanja.

Zakoni koje krije Newtonovo njihalo mogu, primjerice, objasniti odbijanje lopte o tlo kada igramo košarku ili rukomet!

 

Za svaku akciju postoji jednaka ili suprotna reakcija

Iako Newtonovo njihalo nije izumio Isaac Newton, ono uspješno prikazuje treći Newtonov zakon gibanja - za svaku akciju postoji jedna i suprotna reakcija. U prijevodu na našu situaciju, udruživanjem snaga zauzvrat ćemo prikupiti dovoljna sredstava za novo Newtonovo njihalo znanstvenog edukativno-zabavnog centra. 

 

$ 10,000  =  1 NEWTONOVO NJIHALO

 

Ne, čekajte - ako nam se pridružite dobit ćete i više! :) Izborom jedne od nagrada s desne strane, dobit ćete jednaku i suprotnu reakciju u zauzvrat za vašu novčanu donaciju.

Mašta na kvadrat!

Vjerujemo da je znanost savršen odgovor na dječju znatiželju te u njima može raspiriti ideju kako je i oni mogu koristiti za pronalazak odgovora na neka od najvećih pitanja današnjice. Zato smo pokrenuli Znanstveni piknik, čiju je vrijednost kroz posljednje 4 godine prepoznalo više od 100,000 posjetitelja, prvenstveno djeca i mladi. Želimo nastaviti njegovu tradiciju u Znanstvenom edukativno-zabavnom centru, prvom takve vrste u Hrvatskoj i regiji.

Podržati nas možete donacijom po vašoj želji - svaka će nas jednako razveseliti! Ako novčana donacija za vas ne dolazi u obzir, ima mnogo jednako vrijednih načina kako nam možete pomoći:

1. Sljedeći puta kada se nađete s društvom na kavi, ispričajte im sve o ovoj kampanji. Pobrinite se da im link na kampanju pošaljete odmah nakon toga (čisto da ne zaboravite)!

2. Ležerno je spomenite na sljedećem roditeljskom sastanku. Istaknite da putem kampanje mogu doći do jeftinijih ulaznica za Znanstveni piknik.

3. Onaj dan kada se nećete osjećati produktivno na poslu, pošaljite e-mail o kampanji svome najdražem članu obitelji - osjećat ćete se produktivnije!

Na kraju, uvijek možete PODIJELITI VIJEST O KAMPANJI NA SVOM FACEBOOK, TWITTER ILI INSTAGRAM PROFILU.

Zahvalni smo na potpori 

Vidimo se u Centru za popularizaciju znanosti! <3

*****

Science Picnic Is Getting Under a Roof!

Science Picnic, the biggest science-popularisation event in Croatia and the region is getting a roof over it's head - in three months from now it will grow into a Centre For Science Popularisation of Science, a place where children and youth will have a chance to explore science in fun ways throughout the whole year.

The new science edutainment centre will gather all the best from the Science Picnic's program: 

LECTURES OF TOP CROATIAN SCIENTISTS

EXPERIMENTS

SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS AND EXPONENTS

Only one thing will be missing - a giant Newton's cradle.

THE GIANT

A giant Newton's cradle has been one of the most tempting exponents to play with from the Science Picnic's day one. Mainly known as a small office-desk toy, Newton's cradle launched to a new level of "entertaining" when it showed up at the Science Picnic in a much larger form - everybody wanted to try it, which naturally led to asking "What is this for?" and learning about the basic principles of physics.

In fact, after 4 intense years of ball-kicking at the Science Picnic, the cradle got quite damaged and will be used for the last time at this September's event. Also, because it's quite a pricy instrument, so far we've been using a borrowed cradle. Now, that we're preparing for the opening of the new science edutainment centre, this means exactly what you're thinking - we want a new one, our own Newton's cradle! 

This one will be even better than the one we used throughout the last years. Besides being of a size of one large room, making it impossible not to explore how it functions, it's balls will be fillable with different substances, such as sand and water, making learning even more insightful. Moreover, this will be a safety-approved Newton's cradle, designed for exhibiting and demonstrations.

WAIT - What Can We Learn From It?

Despite the fact it was initially created as an office toy for relaxation and motivation, Newton's Cradle was named in honour of scientist and mathematician Isaac Newton. The device demonstrates some of the fundamental laws of physics in a simple and fun way, which makes it a great toy for interaction and learning:

  • CONSERVATION OF ENERGY -> If we hold up and release one of the balls, the ball on the opposite end will move at the same speed and height, due to energy exchange.
  • CONSERVATION OF MOMENTUM -> The first ball doesn't just swing off the second one and bounce back due to conservation of momentum in the direction of motion, meaning it will move in one direction until it reaches the final ball.
  • FRICTION -> The sequence will continue back and forth until the balls eventually stop. This happens due to friction inside the balls, converting enough energy to stop them from moving

Principles behind Newton's Cradle can, for example, explain why does the ball bounce off the ground when we play basketball and handball!

For Every Action There Is An Equal and Opposite Reaction

Newton's Cradle wasn't really invented by Isaac Newton, but it successfully represents Newton's 3rd law of motion - for every action there is an equal and opposite reaction. In translation to this specific situation, if we join our forces together, we'll have enough funds to get the new Newton's cradle for the science edutainment centre in return!

 

 $ 10,000  =  1 NEWTON'S CRADLE

 

No, wait - if you join us, you'll get even more! :)

By choosing one of the perks on your right side, you'll also get an equal and opposite reaction for you monetary donation. If you're stated in Croatia or the region you will be able to experience  Science Picnic in September and science edutainment centre in December from first hand. If not, you can enable that experience for school children from this area!

Let's Spark Them up!

We believe that science is a perfect answer to children's natural curiosity and can spark an idea in their minds that they, too, can use science for finding answers to world's biggest question - that's why we started the Science Picnic, that has over 4 years gathered more than 100,000 visitors, mainly children and youth. We want to continue it's tradition at the science edutainment centre, the first of such kind in Croatia and the region. 

You can show us your valuable support by any amount you wish - all will make us happy! If a monetary donation isn't an option for you, there are many equally important ways you can help us: 

1. Next time you meet up with your friends over a coffee, tell them all about this. Make sure to send them a link to the campaign and make sure to do it right as you say it (just so you don't forget about it later).

2. Casually mention it to another parent at the parents meeting. Point out this is a cheaper way for them to get the entry tickets to the Science Picnic.

3. That day when you'll feel really unproductive at work, e-mail a link to the campaign to your favourite relative - you'll feel more productive.

Finally, you can always SHARE THE CAMPAIGN ON YOUR FACEBOOK, TWITTER OR INSTAGRAM ACCOUNT.

See you at the Centre For Science Popularisation! <3
